direction.raw_text: Algren sits alone on the bed. He takes out a leather-bound journal and begins to write.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) June 17th, 1876. The dead are with me tonight. They return each time I am obliged to tell their story. INT.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Algren sips absinthe. He stares at the milky, green liquid before him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Algren walks in the fog. Sputtering gas lamps give an unearthly glow.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) I can almost see them in the shadows, their bodies whole and beautiful once more. Sometimes it's as if they call to me in a sweet invitation -- 7. EXT.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) "We are dead," they whisper, "and we are happy." INT.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Algren is back in the hotel room. From his small suitcase, he takes the Medal of Honor, looks at it for a long moment.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Algren looks up. He knows that voice. He carefully puts the revolver back into the suitcase and shuts it before opening the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: toda y. Very inspiring... .
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) "Do not be afraid," they whisper. "You have been dead, too." A sudden flash: We are back on Sutter's Hill. Algren's slaughtered cavalry litter the bloody ground, dead to the last man. A rebel army surgeon gives a cursory look at each body before it is loaded onto a wagon. Algren's turn is no different than the others. He is declared dead and hoisted unceremoniously onto the pile of corpses. Back in the. hotel room.: Algren sits, staring into the middle distance.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) Is this why they gave their lives? So that I might disgrace their memory? He reaches into the suitcase and takes out a Colt revol ver. Stares at it, cracks the cylinder to make sure it's loaded. His finger wraps around the trigger, the barrel makes its wa y toward his head. And then, unaccountabl y, he is laughing.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) And why, after taking so many lives, do I find myself incapable of taking just one more? A KNOCK on the door. Algren shuts his eyes, then calls out.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Go awa y.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V .O.) Not exactly the greeting I imagined.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Thought you'd seen the last of me, I expect. Algren is filled with emotion, which he tries to hide.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Zeb... They embrace.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Sit. Please. Gant moves to the proffered chair with a pronounced limp.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: ... Saw your little melodrama
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Given up soldiering to become a critic? Gant smiles and shakes his head.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Got a job for you, unless you're running for office...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I have I job.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I mean a real job. Back in uniform.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: m retired.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I don't mean a U.S. uniform. Algren looks at him. Curious despite himself. INT.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Gant leads Algren into a lush San Francisco restaurant. Flickering gaslight and trays of lobster. COLONEL BENJAMIN BAGLEY (whom we saw in flashback) sits with the three Japanese men. Bagley's hair has greyed. He
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . has his eye on a political future.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Omura suddenly speaks. His English is flawless.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Nathan, good to see you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (stunned) Colonel Bagley...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Sit down. This is Mr. Omura, from Japan, and his two associates who, so far as I can tell, don't have names... OMURA 40, is a handsome and intelligent man. He watches Algren closel y as Algren pours a glass or whiskey from a decanter.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: They're looking to hire real American soldiers to create the first Japanese Imperial Army. Algren looks at him.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Japan's got it in mind to become a civilized country and they're willing to spend what it takes to hire white experts to do the job right. Algren takes a slow lip of whiskey.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Sergeant Gant has already agreed to serve. You would be m y second-in-command.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . With approval from Washington, of course.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Both governments prefer to consider our mission unofficial. We'd be there as non-combatants
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: only, advisors to the Japanese officers. Help them with training, ordinance and the like.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You ought to think about it., Captain. Unless you intend to take up a career in the theater.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I have an agreement with the Winchester Corporation -- I'm sure these people have some concept of what an agreement is.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You are paid seven dollars for each performance. You do, on average, fourteen performances a year. We will pay you 400 dollars.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: A year?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: A month. Algren looks at him. The figure, in 1876, is staggering. EXT
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: A steamship chums its wa y across the great Pacific. Algren leans on the ship's rail and looks out into an endless processi on of wa ves.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) June 23, 1876. It is impossible, standing here, not to appreciate one's, own insignificance. A dolphin crests the surface, arcing into the air.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) Here there is neither past, nor future. Only an oblivion of water. In his tiny cabin, Algren finishes writing in his journal and takes out a daguerreot ype of a HAUNTINGLY BEAUTIFUL BLOND WOMAN.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) And yet I ask myself, will the dead follow me across the ocean to this strange new land? He stares at the woman in the picture. INT.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: In the main cabin, Algren sits with Gant and Omura. Algren is drinking.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Point him at the enemy. He was born for it. INT.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: ...After the Shogun gave up power, the daimyos you would call them warlords --knew that Japan needed a centralized government. So they asked
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: the hereditary Emperor, His Highness the Enlightened Meiji, to lead the country.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: And these warlords just ... gave up hundreds of years of power?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Economic incentives were offered. Most provincial leaders saw the financial benefits of modernization.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What about those that didn't?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: To deal with those who have resisted, the Emperor has decided to create an Army with allegiance only to him... We considered hiring advisors from Germany, but your Ambassador reminded us of your experience in suppressing rebellious elements in your Civil War. This evocation of the Civil War is not lost on Algren.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Who are we supposed to be fighting against?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: His name is Mori Katsumoto. He is samurai.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Samurai?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The word you might use it "warrior". But that does not quite capture it ... Katsumoto once served the Emperor but he is now a traitor who leads a band of traitors. He must be punished. Algren looks pointedly at Bagley.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You told them about our experiences together on Sutter's Hill, did you, Colonel?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: They know I was your commanding officer. Yes. Algren glares at Bagley, then stands.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Excuse me, gentlemen. I need some air. (to Omura) I'm sure Colonel Bagley can amuse you with more stories of patriotic gore. He walks away.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He is insolent.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Get him in front of the troops, you'll see. Top of his class at West Point. Brilliant tactician. Even wrote a book.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Why did he leave your army?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What's a hero to do when there's no more great battles?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Is that an evasive answer?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Sir, this man was left for dead at Sutter's Hill. Doct ors swore his heart had stopped beating, but before they could bury him, he came back to life. After the war he fought the Sioux, the Cree, and the Blackfoot. (leans closer)
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Algren lies in his cramped berth. Can't sleep. A sudden flash: On the wagon of dead bodies, Algren's eyes open to stare into the unblinking eyes of his brother, Davey, half his face shot off. He tries to move but be is buried beneath the weight of those piled on top of him. Blood drips down into his eyes and mouth, blinding and choking him. Back to the ship: Algren awakens, bathed in sweat. Terror. A silhouette in the doorwa y.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Colonel Bagley stands looking down at him.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I hope you realize the kind of second chance this is for you. I won't tolerate insubordination. Algren reaches for a nearby glass, drains it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Court-martial me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Would you rather I hadn't recommended you for the medal. Nathan? Is that it?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We both know why you helped me, Colonel. Don't expect me to go all weepy with gratitude.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I expect you to do your job. Save the self-pity for your own time. He turns and walks out, leaving Algren to stare at the empty glass. EXT.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Algren and Gant stand at the rail.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Hate boats. If the Lord bad wanted man to sail he wouldn't have created infantry.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: How many rimes you puke today?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm down to two. Omura comes up next to them.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I understand you are a scholar, Captain Algren. (to Gant) Have you read his book., Mr. Gant?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Can't say I have.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: An analysis of the triumph of weapons technology over antiquated military tactics.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (wr y) A real page-turner. Sold twelve copies.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Nonetheless, I was impressed. I enjoy reading military history. I spent two years studying English at Princeton University.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: And where did you learn to speak Japanese? Omura is perplexed by Algren's remark, then realizes he is being kidded. He laughs heartily. Algren laughs with him. A connection is made.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes, and in Japanese there are twenty-seven words for "war." I will be impressed if you learn only half of them. . He walks away. Algren watches him go. His face darkens.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I got twenty-seven words too - Reb, Sioux, Pawnee, Blackfoot, Jappo. Only one language when it comes to war. EXT.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Like all Japan, Yokohama is at the cusp of a new era. Ancient sampans and wooden schooners beside freighters and steamships. EXT.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: After 23 days at sea, they are all glad to climb down the gangplank. The Yokohama docks are a frenzy of languages and looks and smells and sounds. Japanese competes with German and English and French and Russian. Warehouses fl y the flags of a dozen countries. One striking Japanese character dominates: the symbol for, Omura. It is seen on buildings, warehouses, and the headbands of scores of laborers. A series of palanquins, litters carried by bearers, await our voyagers. As does SIMON GRAHAM, a dissipated Englishman who has lived in Japan for many yean. Slender and pale, with an occasional consumptive cough, in his 50's, he wears a white linen suit, a bit worse for wear.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: PALANQUIN - YOKOHAMA STREETS                             DAY Their bearers maneuver them through the bustling streets of Yokohama. White face painted geishas walk alongside bearded Russians. Traditional Japanese kimonos alongside European suits and hats, schizophrenic world of ancient Japan versus modern commercialism.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Captain Algren, this is Mr. Simon Graham. He will be your translator.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Pleasure, Captain.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You'll be quartered at the Embassy for now.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The Emperor will summon you at his pleasure. Graham ushers Algren and Gant into their own less-ornate version.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: If you please, Captain...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: They're gonna carry us?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You're guests of the Emperor. You cannot walk. Algren notes the hoods covering the faces of the palanquin bearers.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Why the hoods?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: So you won't have to burden your eyes by looking at slaves. Oh, excuse me, they're servants now. (coughs, wipes a bit of blood) This wa y, gentlemen... INT /EXT
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Twenty years ago Yokohama was a lovel y little port. Then your Commodore Perry arrived and changed all that.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: All this in twenty years?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Japan has...embraced... Western wa ys. Hired lawyers from France, doctors from Germany, naval architects from Britain, civil engineers, railway designers, scientists, teachers. And, of course, warriors from the United States.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Buying the future.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Or selling the past... INT.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: A shoji screen is opened by a bowing servant to reveal the clean, classic lines of a Japanese room. Algren is about to enter when Graham stops him, indicating for Algren to remove his boots. Algren scowls, confused, and struggles to pull off the high, filthy boots. He takes in the foreigness of the room, an arrangement of fl owers on a low table.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: No chairs? . .
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Correct. And this-- (points to a mat) ..is your bed.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: And this? He points to a block of wood.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Your pillow.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You mean to say there are no real beds in Japan?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: For its entire history Japan his been completely aakoku, I "closed country." Thirty years ago, if you had washed up on Japanese soil... you would have been beheaded on sight. Now, they let you keep your head... and give you a wooden pillow. EXT.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . GARDEN                     DAYS LATER In the pristine grounds of the Embassy, a garden party is in progress. Incongruous lilting Yankee tunes are heard from the Japanese band. Algren and Gant, now in their dress uniforms wander through the party with Graham. Liveried servants pall trays of canapes. Elsewhere we see diplomats representing all the powers currently trying to devour Japan: Russia; England; Germany; France; Spain; etc.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . EXT.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I remember when it was just America and the Dutch. Now ever ybody' s getting into the game. They pass two German diplomats. The Germans glance to Algren and Gant with suspicion, bow tersely. Graham greets them in German.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The Germans are particularly eager.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What do they want?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Same thing your country wants. Most favored nation status.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: How long have you been in Japan?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh, western time quickly loses its meaning here ... I first came as part of the British legation in 1857. But I was soon relieved of m y position, as a result of various...disagreements with the Crown's attitude toward the locals. Omura separates himself from his entourage and approaches.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Gentlemen. I hope you are enjoying a taste of home.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I've done with worse, believe me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: America has much to offer us, though. Its' industry and ingenuity are without peer. (ingratiating) I have spoken to the Emperor about you. He is interested in the most modem theories of warfare.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I look forward to the opportunity of meeting him someday.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You will have that chance sooner than you think. He has requested an audience. Graham is open-mouthed at this turn of events.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Algren and Bagley sit with Graham in an ornate carriage as they cross the moat and enter the ancestral palace of the Shoguns. INT.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Algren waits with Bagley and Graham outside the throne room.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Remember that he is arahitogami. A god in human form. During the last two hundred years no emperor was even seen by commoner. You may look at him, with deference, but do not speak unless you are spoken to. EXT.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Algren and Gant are surprised to discover the living god is barely in his twenties. The divine EMPEROR MEIJI is an intelligent and curious young man, yet there is a tentativeness about him. His throne is surrounded by ADVISORS, principal among them is Omura. Nearby, the American AMBASSADOR SWANBECK a cagey diplomat The throne room itself is sweeping, beautiful, and extremely restrained. Everywhere, tasteful displays of the traditional flower of the monarchy: chrysanthemums. The vibrant yellow bl ossoms haunt the chamber. As the Emperor considers his guests, Omura whispers into his ear. Then:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: PALACE GARDEN                       DAY A1gren, Graham, and Bagley walk through the palace grounds.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: The Emperor bids you welcome. He wishes you to know that he is most grateful for the assistance your country offers ours, in order to rid ourselves of the brutality of the provincial warlords - and to accomplish the same national harmony which you enjoy in your homeland. The Emperor speaks in Japanese. The advisors are non-plussed, and Omura leans down for a moment to confer with him, then smiles indulgently:
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The Emperor is most interested in your American Indians, and wishes to know if you have seen them firsthand. Algren looks at Graham, who nods. He may speak.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I have seen many of them, and have fought them, too. They are very brave. Graham translates. The Emperor nods and smiles.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (accented English) Thank... you... very ...much. He stands. Everyone else hurries to follow suit. The audience is over. EXT.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That young pup runs this country?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That "pup" runs the country no more than I do. He was installed as a figurehead at age twelve when the warlords realized Japan needed a central government. But don't be fooled -- he may be a powerless god, but to these people he's a god nonetheless. GENERAL YOSHITAKA appears. He is a seasoned soldier in his 40's. A decent man. He stops before them, bows quickly.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Gentlemen, may I present General Yoshitaka. He will assist you in training the army.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: General. Algren offers his hand. General Yoshitaka does not take it. He bowl his head and speaks a few words. Graham translates:
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He greets you with extreme courtesy and asks if you are ready to meet the Imperial Army. EXT.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: About a thousand Japanese soldiers in baggy uniforms are milling around a large parade ground. Each has an old single shot rifle. Algren, Gant, and Yoshitaka look down on them from a reviewing stand.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Jesus....
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Ask the General what training they' ve had. Graham speaks to General Yoshitaka, then translates his response.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He sa ys... We have trained them not to shoot their ...asses off. Algren glances to General Yoshitaka, who looks back wr yl y.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Sergeant Gant, have the men stand to attention.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Imperial Army, Atten-tion! Graham translates, rather mildly.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: For God's sake, let's not keep it a secret who's in charge here ... Mr. Gant.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (roars)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: !! As the soldiers immediately stand to attention, we begin a montage of the training of the first Imperial Army: We see Gant drilling the men. Shouting at his translator. Trying to get them to march in formation. Algren is nearby, watching.
dialogue.name: dialogue

result.heading: ALL RIGHT YOU SLANTY-EYED LITTLE BASTARDS STAND UP STRAIGHT OR I WILL SHIT-KICK EVERY ONE OF YOU COCKSUCKERS

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) August 4,1876. As I watch this new army train, I cannot help but think of those who rode with me in me 23rd cavalry. Algren sits in his tent, writing in his journal. Outside, the Japanese are being taught the basics of firing tactics.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) For four years they had survived, never once shrinking from the fire. And so, when given my order to charge the advancing rebel infantry, they never hesitated. ...And they all died. We see Algren showing the Japanese how to fire in formation. The old single-shot rifles they carry make reloading a painfully slow process.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V .O.) Now I am training another army. In another civil war. Algren and Gant spar with sabers - Algren's expertise far exceeds Gant's, a fact which Gant accepts with good humor.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) Is this why I was spared? Once again to lead men to their death? It is sunset Algren, Graham, and General Yoshitaka watch the training. General Yoshitaka speaks. YOSHlTAKA/ GRAHAM ... the problem is they're peasants. They have never had this sort of responsibility or power. Algren watches Gant march beside the Japanese. They are illuminated by the majestic red sunset
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to Graham) Ask him if they have a flag. Graham translates. Genera1 Yoshitaka responds.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No flag.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: They need a flag. EXT.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Tokyo is a city in chaos. Everything seems out of balance. Dystopic. A collision of Eastern and Western. Algren and Gant watch as Graham prepares to take a photograph of an old merchant in front of his store.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Most of the people on the sidewalk instantly step out of the wa y, bowing in deference. But two young Japanese in Western dress do not. Ujio stands before them, waiting for them to move. They don't. Tense words are exchanged. Ujio glares at them. Algren watches.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: ... I've been doing this for years. Trying to capture it before it's all gone. Afraid I'm losing the battle. Algren silently watches the passers-by. Something draws his attention: Across the street. a man is striding down the crowded sidewalk. His martial bearings, two swords, traditional dress and unique top knot of hair instantly identify him to us as a samurai.                                       . We will meet him again later, he is UJIO. A terse, grim man in his 40's. His proud gait and rigid, imperious manner intrigue Algren.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Mr. Graham...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Ah... now this should be interesting... He's waiting for them to show deference. Across the street, Uji o barks out some harsh commands to the two Japanese men. They laugh in response. Then one of the men raises a hand and barks some clearly disrespectful words back-- Like lightning-- Ujio pulls out his long samurai sword - it flashes -- Cleanly beheading the disrespectful Japanese man -- The beheaded corpse begins to fall-- In one smooth motion, Ujio wipes his blade clean of the corpse as it falls and sweeps it back into its scabbard. The other man immediately drops to his belly, prostrating himself. Without another glance, Ujio walks awa y. His face is completely impassive.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What the hell was that?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That...is a samurai. INT.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Sergeant Gant gazes unhappily at his dinner: glistening raw fish; tepid beancurds; boiled rice. Algren, Gant, Graham, and General Yoshitaka sit cross-legged on the floor. Gant finds this extremely uncomfortable.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: ... Before the edicts ever y citizen had to prostrate himself in the presence of a samurai.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What edicts are those?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The Council of State has been passing a series of laws designed to eliminate the samurai.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Why?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Because you are here now, Sergeant... For the last 800 years guarding Japan and fighting her wars was the exclusive occupation of the samurai. The next course arrives. Thick, black eel. Gant groans.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Men like Mori Katsumoto were the most elite caste in Japanese societ y until the Council of State -- led by your friend Omura - decided the whole class had to go ... (munching eel) ... Most of the samurai accepted the new laws. But some didn't. Or couldn't. Like Katsumoto. General Yoshitaka speaks up. Graham translates:
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: General Yoshitaka bids you to remember that the word samurai means "one who serves." Their whole existence is based on serving their country as warriors. Graham finishes translating, then continues on his own:
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . Your Imperial Army is taking awa y their only reason for being ... So what are they to do now? Algren considers this as he pours another cup of sake.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: This is sake?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Sake. Rice wine.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hie! Sake.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Sake.. (to Yoshitaka) Good. Yoshitaka nods. Enthusiastically tries an English word.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Good!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Vexing people, the samurai. Blood-thirsty, honorable, cruel, fabulousl y artistic. Wanted to write a book about them for years, but no Westerner can get close enough.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Ask him if he ever saw a samurai in battle. Graham looks at A1gren.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Later that night. Algren and Gant, a little drunk by now, wander Tokyo's bustling red light district. Like Amsterdam, the geishas sit in windows facing the street. INT.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is certainly not the whorehouse they expected. Elegant Japanese furnishings. Lovel y flute music. The MADAM lowers her head and speaks quietly in greeting.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . One of the Geishas smile. Her teeth are blackened, to better set off the whiteness of her face paint
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: My friend and I were looking for some companionship... The Madam speaks no English. Gant speaks louder, as if to a deaf person.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Ladies of the evening? Hootchie-contchie? Boom-Boom?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: ( embarrassed) Zeb. (tries a bow to the madam) ...so sorry. Gant flashes a fistful of Japanese currency.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Universal language. boyo. The Madam nods and bows. Almost magically, two beautifully-dressed GEISHAS appear, their faces are painted pure white.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That one's yours. INT.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Algren and Gant are led into an elegant room with paper screens, and a table set for the Japanese tea ceremony.                                               . Gant tries to take the arm of one of the geishas - but she moves awa y, gesturing for him to sit The other begins the tea ceremony.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: No tea... Sake. A musician plays a traditional lute. The geisha begins a graceful fan dance.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Fan dance. Saw this once in Chicago. Algren smiles at the Geisha preparing the. She smiles back. Algren pours himself a cup of sake. Later... The sake bottle is empty. The interminable lute music continues. Gant is increasingly agitated as the geisha continues her dance. Algren can't help but laugh at his frustration. Finally Gant has had enough. He rises, a bit unsteady from the sake.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Okay, darlin' time to get down to business: He shoos the musician out of the room, then approaches the geisha, who shrinks from his intention.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Zeb. I don't think she -- GANT She's just shy. Who knows what we white devils have got in our trousers, eh, darlin'? He takes her arm. She resists - her voice rising.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Come on, now. He tries to pull her along. Her kimono tears. She calls out in terror. Two men appear, bouncers presumably, but alight of build.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh, shit. The Madam yells angrily at Gant in Japanese. Pushing him out roughly.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Now, hold on there, sister. I paid good money. One of the bouncers puts his hand, politely, on Gant's arm.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Back off, short-stuff. This time, the bouncer is more insistent. Gant takes a swing at him. Wrong move. Before Gant knows what hit him, the little man uses Gant's momentum in an akido move to flip him to the mat, hard. Algren can only stare, in awe, at the lethal move. As the second bouncer moves to confront him, bowing apologetically, Algren speaks in English, smiling, knowing they can't understand a word he's saying.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Obviousl y you can kick the shit out of people much larger than you, so we'll be leaving now... EXT.

direction.raw_text: The training continues. We see Gant, now sporting a black eye. Algren walks with General Yoshitaka and Graham. Graham translates:
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: The General wishes to know if you bad a pleasant evening? Algren looks at Yoshitaka, who gives him. wry look..
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It was... educational (Yoshitaka nods) Would the General mind telling me more about our common enemy? Yoshitaka looks at him. Has Algren deliberately used the word, "enemy," knowing that Yoshitaka, too, is a samurai? Algren gives nothing awa y.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: ... Mori Katsumoto is an extremely charismatic leader. To those who honor the old ways, he's a hero. His force is estimated at about five hundred and growing by the day. All samurai.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What kind of man is be? Graham translates. General Yoshitaka considers his words.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Katsumoto has no fear. He has no pity. He is kotsutai-- the soul of old Japan ... He is my honored kinsman.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Kinsman?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We grew up together in Yoshino. Marched together and fought together. He is Kaishaku the brother of my spirit. Algren considers this as they observe rifle practice. Erratic but improving. Algren notes Yoshitaka's reaction. The rifles seem to make him unhappy.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Ask him what kind of guns Katsumoto has.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The samurai don't use guns.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No, ask him what kind of firearms they have. Graham obliges. Yoshitaka responds, with disdain:
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The samurai no longer dishonor themselves by touching firearms. Algren is surprised at this bit of information. A servant approaches, bows.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Colonel Bagley requires you. INT.

direction.raw_text: Colonel Bagley and Algren stand at a map. Omura sits.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He bows and leaves them alone. Bagley spins on A1gren.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Railroad workers are laying a new spur, building a brick station. A1gren notes the by now familiar Omura symbol on the new water tower and on the headbands of the guards and workers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . EXT.

direction.raw_text: . tow. Gant watches as they head out of harm's wa y.                      .
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . The Japanese troops are terrified
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . They are surrounded. Algren, Gant, and the Japanese Offi cers call out orders but all discipline soon breaks down -- it is every man for himself-- The battle swirls ever ywhere around us. Fleeing soldiers are run through by lances, run down and trampled by horses. Each samurai wears individual, vibrantly col ored armor. Various battle flags sweep through the fog. Gant uses his two cavalry revolvers -- firing constantly -- finally out of ammo he drops from his horse in the cavalry st yle and pulls a Winchester repeating rifle, crouching and quickly firing-- Algren uses his revol ver first -- firing as he turns on his horse -- when the revol ver is empty he pulls his cavalry saber. He manages to parry the lethal blows as the Samurai hurtle past -- But one Samurai, his armor all in black, comes at him on a collision course and SLAMS INTO HIM, sending both horse and rider to the ground. Algren scrambles to his feet, his saber nowhere to be found as another rider heads toward him carrying a lance. Algren manages to grab it and throw the rider to the ground, wrestling the lance from his grip and running him through. In the midst of the battle we notice a peculiar thing. One samurai is just sitting on his horse. Watching Algren. This samurai wears a BLACK MASK. The MASKED SAMUARI watches Algren fight. Algren now wields the lance to battle the horsemen as they sweep past. He spears one and then unseats another. When a third samurai cuts his lance in half, Algren uses the remaining half as a club to take him down. The Masked Samurai continues to watch Algren. Algren's tenacity is amazing. He continues to fight with heroic passion, refusing to give an inch, long after Those around him have fled. Then a blaze of bright yellow  a samurai in yellow armor galloping past, firing arrows steadily from horseback. His control and speed are astounding. We will come to know him as YORITOMO, a handsome young samurai. Yoritomo fires arrow upon arrow  the speed is breathtaking  Two arrows slam into Gant, knocking him to the ground. The battle, meanwhile, has become a rout. Those Imperial soldiers who fight are easily cut down. Those who flee are run down like prey. Left alone, Algren finds himself confronted by ashigaru  samurai foot soldiers carrying pikes. He turns to discover his retreat cut off by other 34. samurai wielding katana  the lethal long sword. But rather than give any quarter, Algren launches an attack. He kills one samurai before he is RUN THROUGH, at the shoulder, by a lance. In agony, Algren SNAPS OFF the hilt of the lance, leaving its tip buried deep in his chest, and fights on. He manages to parry a blow  which SLICES into his side. The next blow takes off a piece of his scalp. Blood fl ows down his faces and into his eyes. Algren is now surrounded by ten samurai. A man's heroic stand against certain death is of great interest to them. As they begin to close in, Algren whirls the lance around, a tattered battle-flag with TIGER INSIGNIA still dangling from the end. The MASKED SAMURAI removes his mask. It is the JAPANESE MAN, whose dream of the tiger we glimpsed at the beginning of the story. His eyes wide in surprise, he watches his dream come to life--the blue tiger holding the dogs at bay. In SLOW MOTION Algren whirls the lance, as one samurai, wearing BLOOD-RED ARMOR, advances. With a murderous smile, he draws his katana. Algren seems spent  he drops to one knee, swaying, on the brink of losing consciousness. . But as the RED SAMURAI, lets out a battle cry and propels himself forward for the death blow - Algren suddenly LEAPS UP and propels the jagged wooden end of the broken lance into the unprotected throat of his attacker. As the samurai falls, the rest of his comrades close in to cut Algren off. A harsh COMMAND stops them in their tracks. The Masked Samurai leaps from his horse. Everyone steps aside deferentially so that be might pass by without being jostled.                    . He looks down at Algren, then removes his battle helmet. And we meet _MORI KATSUMOTO, the leader of the samurai. He it an imposing man of about Algren's years. Sensing that he is about to be killed, Algren pulls himself t o his knees, and SWINGS his saber at Katsumoto. With blinding speed, Katsumoto pulls his katana from its scabbard. Algren's saber is SNAPPED CLEANLY IN TWO. Katsumoto looks down at Algren. Then Gant appears behind Katsumoto -- limping toward him, cocking his rifle, urgently trying to save Algren-- Ujio, (the Samurai we saw earlier on the streets of Tokyo) leaps to protect his Lord. His sword flashes-- 35. Gant is eviscerated. Algren watches in horror. A dreadful beat as Gant stands, pathetically trying to hold his guts in. Then he sinks to his knees. Katsumoto turns, leaps back onto his horse and trots off. Algren finally wrenches himself from under his horse. He crawls to Gant, blood pouring from his own injured back and shoulder. Gant is dead. Algren looks up to see the battle is lost. The Japanese soldiers have fled. Or are surrendering, injured or dead. And he sees one other thing. General Yoshitaka is still on his horse, head down. He has not pulled his sword. He has not been hurt. Katsumoto rides to Yoshitaka. A few serious words are exchanged. Katsumoto bows his bead in respect, seems to agree to something. Both men climb from their horses. General Yoshitaka pulls out a small b1ade and hands it to Katsumoto, who holds it out firmly. General Yoshitaka quickly and calmly pulls himself on to the blade, plunging it into his stomach, embracing Katsumoto. It is seppuku -- the traditional form of samurai suicide. Algren watches, stunned. Then a terrible scream cuts through the battlefield. Algren sees samurai calmly walking among the injured and captured Imperial soldiers .. killing them one by one with a single stroke. Algren looks over the slaughter. And then passes out, bill wounds overcoming him. Fade to... EXT.

Omura guards herd them about rather bruta1ly.

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) October 24,1876. Today we entered Kansai province. Here the local warlords have all been convinced to accept the emperor's rule. They pass a particularly wrenching sight. Villagers kneeling outside what used to be a Shinto temple. The railroad tracks cut straight through it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) Our destination is Yoshino, home of the rebel Katsumoto. Protected by high mountain passes, it can be reached only during the summer months, and even then with great difficulty. The Army moves on. Ahead are towering mountains. EXT.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The Imperial Army winds its way up I steep mountain pass.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) A long march. And then a battle. A new enemy, but the same feeling I had in my guts at twenty-one, in the cornfield at Antietam -- men will die here, today, and will I be among them?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Fog. Obscuring everything. Algren and Bagley, on horseback, wait with Graham. General Yoshitaka and a few Japanese Commanders are mounted as well. The thousand strong Japanese Army is on foot They stand, rifles ready.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to Graham) Ask him how they'll come at us. Graham speaks to General Yoshitaka. Yoshitaka responds:
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: They'll come straight on. They will push forward and keep on attacking... And he adds that there is no samurai word for "retreat." Algren prepares himself. They wait. General Yoshitaka is suddenly alert. He speaks quietly to Graham.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He sa ys they're coming... Algren gazes into the thick fog ahead, sees nothing. Bagley looks worried.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Captain Algren, have you posted a rear guard to protect our supply train?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Who is overseeing their deployment? Algren is somewhat confused by the question.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No one.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Mr. Graham, you will accompany me to the rear. I want to be certain we are protected from any surprise assault.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes. Of course. Before Algren can respond, Bagley has left the front lines with Graham in
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Son of a bitch.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (almost to himself) ...I'm going to kill him.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Waste of good ammo. Gant checks his two revol vers. The methodical clicking of the chambers as he checks his rounds is the only sound.                                         . Then absolute silence. A light SNOW begins to fall. Algren continues to peer into the fog. Nothing. Then a sound ... distant ... building through the fog... The steady rumble of horses. Slowl y approaching. Closer and closer... Algren notes some of the Japanese soldiers are literally shaking in fear. Algren peers again into the fog. Nothing. But the sound is closer. Then the sound abruptly stops. Silence broken only by the murmured prayers of some of the soldiers.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Sergeant Gant, order the troops to assume staggered firing positions.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Imperial Army, assume staggered firing positions. His order is translated. The Japanese soldiers prepare to fire, one row kneeling, the other standing behind them. One of the Japanese soldiers faints from sheer tension. Algren can see nothing through the dense fog. The tension is unbearable. Then a form on horseback... ghostly... like lame sort of medieval monster. An elaborate, horned helmet. Sweeping samurai armor. All we can see it the eerie silhouette in the fog. Like something from a nightmare. And then another figure... and another ... as 500 mounted samurai warriors slowl y move into position.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (quickly) Hold the line ... hold the line... The order is translated. A terrible, beautiful moment of absolute stasis. Nothing moves. The Japanese soldiers wait. The ghostly silhouettes wait. Silence. Then -- as if a silent signal were given -- the samurai suddenly CHARGE, emerging from the fog in a great wave--! The force of a tsunami. The silence is shattered as the charging samurai roar out ancient war- cries that chill the blood -- sweeping forward on their hones like lightning -swords and spears flashing
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: ! The Japanese troops fire then quickly begin trying to reload their single shot rifles -- others fumble at the ask and then break and run-- Panic and chaos--
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hold the line! Too late-- the samurai are on them-- They attack with an intensity few have ever seen -- many of the Japanese soldiers try to escape, turning and running in blind panic -- they are butchered-- run through by the ashigaru, cut inhalf by the naginata. Those soldiers who laboriousl y try to reload their rifles are quickly mowed down by ferocious clouds of samurai arrows, fired by mounted Samurai.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Sound fall back! Sound fall back! A bugler sounds the order. The Army begins to retreat. But suddenly they are attacked from behind as well! Arrows shoot from the fog and more mounted samurai appear.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Algren is unconscious, tied to a horse. The mounted samurai move up a treacherous mountain pass, disappearing into the soaring mountains of Yoshino. EXT.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Katsumoto's village is the other Japan. The Japan we have not yet seen. The gorgeous mountain scenery of Yoshino envelopes the village. Snow- capped mountains soar in the distance. A valley below with rice fields.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . After the turmoil of Tokyo, this place seems a bucolic paradise. Traditional, wooden Japanese architecture. Farming. The sense of harmony so markedly absent from the cities. Algren, barely conscious, hunches over his horse. He has lost a lot of blood. Katsumoto leads his samurai into the village. As he passes, ever y person in the village touches his or her forehead to the ground to show respect. Most of these villagers have never seen a white face and gaze at Algren with curiosity. And suspicion. Katsumoto dismounts in a large square, the rest of his men follow suit. A samurai helps Algren painfully slide from his horse. Katsumoto moves to the steps of the largest house. His officers fall into formation around him. Algren notes Ujio - the grim samurai who killed Gant -- in jet black armor, glaring at him coldl y. Ujio walks forward and SCREAMS at Algren in Japanese. Algren doesn't move. This only makes Ujio more angry. He paces back and forth like a caged panther spitting invective at Algren. Algren doesn't move. He watches Uji o evenly. This takes incredible will. His wounds are so bad that- he can barely stand. SUDDENLY - Ujio draws his long sword -- it slashes through the air - the blade singing -- and stops an inch away from Algren's face! Algren doesn't move. Ujio brings the cutting edge' into contact with Algren's check. Blood runs where even this feather-light touch cuts Algren's skin. Algren doesn't move. Ujio glares at him. Then sheathes his sword and walks away. Katsumoto looks at Algren deepl y, gauging him. Then be speaks. In English. Algren is surprised.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . even feel the pain. He blacks out again. INT.

direction.raw_text: . Yoritomo's face breaks into a wide smile.

dialogue.raw_text: You cannot escape. We are deep in the mountains and winter is coming. Katsumoto turns and walks into his house. Uji o follows him. Algren collapses. Fade to black. As Algren begins his time at the heart of the samurai world. INT.

dialogue.raw_text: Algren'. eyes open... A WOMAN is leaning close, her eyes intent on the task of sewing up his wound. She is beautiful, but he is not really conscious enough to notice, or
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Algren wakes again. He is lying on a simple mat. His injuries are such that he can barely move his head. He takes in the traditional Japanese furnishings. A red ball rolls across the floor. And after it... TOSHIIE, a little boy. around four. The boy l ooks at Algren. offers him the ball. Smiles. A1gren blacks out... INT

dialogue.raw_text: Algren's eyes open... Through the archway he can see Toshiie and his older brother HIGEN, around ten. Also the beautiful WOMAN who earlier was stitching his wound. From his recumbent position, Algren watches as she ministers to the boys, who are dearly her sons. Algren is fascinated by her grace and the sweet attention she gives them. She seems to sense him. Her eyes raise, meet bit. She speaks to someone, and YORITOMO appears. He is twenty-one, too young to be the woman's husband. Yoritomo comes into Algren's room. Speaks to him. Algren shakes his head. Doesn't understand Yoritomo speaks to the woman, who approaches and places bowl of soup in front of Algren. He ignores it The boys stand in the doorwa y. Yoritomo shoos them awa y. Algren glances up at the: woman. Her eyes avoid his, her expression is opaque. INT.

He is impressed at the many battle wounds on Algren's body; the old bullet wounds and scars. In Japanese, he indicates his admiration. Algren his no idea what Yoritomo is saying. Finally he interrupts with the only Japanese word he has bothered to learn:

dialogue.raw_text: Sake?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Sake. Yoritomo glances to the woman. She nods, and brings A1gren a saucer of sake. He drinks it down. Holds out the saucer for a refill Smiling, Yoritomo indicates for the woman to comply, but before she can pour another saucer, Algren takes the jug out of her other hand. Yoritomo laughs as Algren drinks it down. EXT.

dialogue.raw_text: Algren writhes on his mat. Trapped in his recurrent nightmare. A sudden flash: The wagonload of the dead. Davey's bl oody corpse closes in on Algren suffocating him. Back in the house Yoritomo and the woman are asleep in separate rooms. A piercing SCREAM shatters the night EXT.

dialogue.raw_text: Sake. Yoritomo and the woman confer. Yoritomo looks It Algren and shakes his head, no.

dialogue.raw_text: ! Yoritomo refuses -- Algren roars and tries to rise. Laughing at Algren's ferocit y in his weakened condition, Yoritomo easily pushes him back down. Algren folds in on himself, rocking like a feral animal. EXT.

dialogue.raw_text: A glimpse of village life -- fish are hung on lines to dry, children chase each Other, clothes are washed in the river, and in the rice fields below, farmers squat as they have for thousands of years. In his hut, the swordsmith continues to hammer and fold the blade. INT.

direction.raw_text: Algren sits hunched in a dark corner. His body is convulsed with shivering. His withdrawal from alcohol, his wounds, his isolation and his imagined sins are devouring him.                                                                . Then we see he is not alone. The woman stands in the doorway, watching him closel y. Finally she enters with a bowl of soup. He glances up, something like panic in his eyes. She kneels and attempts to hand him the soup, but be knocks it out of the wa y and grabs her by the throat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . EXT.

dialogue.raw_text: Sake! She stares at him, the breath being squeezed out of her, but there is not even a whisper of fear in her eyes. She is utterly impassive. Shaken, he lets her go, and crumples to the floor.                         .
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (mumbling to himself) Sake... The woman leaves the soup and wa1ks away. INT.

dialogue.raw_text: Daylight streams in, finding Algren lying on his back. The worst of the detox is past. As be lies there, these first moments of repose lead to: A sudden flash of memory: The beautiful blond WOMAN from the picture laughs merrily, and falls back languorousl y in a grassy fi eld. Back in the room Algren shakes off the memory as harsh SOUNDS from outside draw him to the window.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Algren watches from the window as the samurai train. It is like nothing else in the world. Part sacred ritual, part martial preparation, samurai training com bines athletic prowess and graceful artistry into one effortless whole. Finally well enough to walk, Algren comes out onto the porch to watch the spectacle. In front of him, is a Kendo (The Way of the Sword) master practice with their long and short swords. They have incredible control. NAKAO, a mountain of a man, is a Karate master. He stands unarmed, four samurai facing him. They attack with wooden swords. He effortlessly defeats them -- the agility of the huge man is shocking. Kyudo ("The Way of the Bow") masters use their bows for target practice. Yoritomo holds a bundle of arrows. In the distance, a line of plums. Algren watches. Yoritomo just seems to stand there, his eyes hall-open. And then -- in a stunning blaze of movement -- Yoritomo fires the arrows -- one after another, amazingly fast -- cleanly hitting each plum. The final arrow splits the previous one as it buries itself in the tree. A wooden sword leans against the porch. Algren idly picks it up, feeling its balance. In a flash, Uji o has raced over and grabbed it from him. Algren stands motionless as Ujio screams at him.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: As the sounds of training resume outside, Algren explores the house. He comes upon Higen and Toshiie playing with the red ball. They are embarrassed to encounter him alone. There's a moment of suspension, and then Higen throws the ball to Algren. Algren looks back and forth between the two boys, fixes his gaze on Higen but throw the ball to Toshiie, causing both boys to laugh and run awa y. Algren walks on. INT.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Algren opens a sliding shojii screen and discovers a small room that has been made into a kind of shrine. Cand1es and incense burn, a small Buddha sits on a dais, and Algren's eyes are drawn to what seems like an apparition standing in the corner. The BRIGHT RED ARMOR of the warrior Algren killed in the fog, is held upright by an unseen stand. It is almost as if the dead warrior himself is swing back at him. Algren senses someone behind him and turns. The woman is standing across the hall. Their eyes meet. She turn, and walks away. EXT.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A first, light snowfall has covered the ground. A1gren walks out into the still night. He turns a corner and confronts curious sight: Ten warriors kneel, motionless in the snow, their eyes closed in concentration. As Algren puzzles over this, he becomes aware that Katsumoto is now standing next to him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They are training. ALGREN Training what?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Algren looks at him. He has never heard the word.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Algren is incredulous.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Their minds. It is called bushido...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The wa y of the warrior. We study from when we are young. Are my words correct? Algren does not respond.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I will practice my Eng1ish with you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Why do you learn English?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: To know m y enemy.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: If I am your enemy, why have you not killed me? Katsumoto doesn't answer.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Was General Yoshitaka your enemy?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No, I honor his memory as my kinsman.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That why you helped him kill himself?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: If a samurai is defeated in battle, he must take his own life to spare himse1f the shame of capture. It is required that his kaishaku his trusted friend, help him. I was honored to by his kaishaku.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hell of an honor.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It was his destiny. He knew it, he died at peace.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Who was the warrior in the red armor?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: My son-in-law. His name was Hiroshi.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: And the woman who cares for me?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: My daughter, Hiroshi's wife. Her name is Taka.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I killed her husband?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It was an honorable death. Katsumoto walks awa y. INT.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Algren it now well enough to kneel at the table with the others. Taka treats him with utter politeness and dignity. He watches her intently, seeking any sign of the animosity he's certain she must feel. She hands him a bowl of rice.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (smiling politely) You hope I choke on it, don't you? She bows, uncomprehending.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You want to poison it and watch me fall over the table and foam at the mouth. Yoritomo bows in response to Algren's new willingness to communicate.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to Taka, subtitles) I promise I'll make him take a bath.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (subtitles) Soon. Please. .EXT.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Yoritomo leads Algren to a large, wooden bathing tub in I secluded part of the village. A banked fire smolders beneath it. Embarrassed, Yoritomo indicates to Algren that be needs to bathe. Algren strips off his filthy uniform then lowers himself into the steaming water. Yoritomo begins taking off hit own kimono. A1gren is taken aback. Used to Western privacy, he is a bit disquieted about bathing with another man. Yoritomo, unconcerned, climbs into the tub. He chats pleasantly as they bathe, showing off his old battle wounds.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Algren's discomfort turns to outright alarm when a toothless old grandmother appears. .She happily strips and joins them in the tub! Algren sinks a little lower into the water. The old grandmother smiles at him with her toothless grin. EXT.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Algren. feeling self-conscious in the clean kimono he's wearing for the first time, walks back with Yoritomo. Kids start walking with them, pointing at his Japanese garb, laughing as he stumbles in his wooden clogs. They pass by Ujio training a group of samurai using wooden kendo swords. Nearby, Higen and Toshiie are imitating the grown-ups, sparring with wooden swords that are much too big for them. Yoritomo watches his nephews proudly, murmuring details of their prowess to Algren, who has no idea what he's talking about. Higen charges his little brother, but goes careening past, right toward Algren, who deftl y dodges out of the wa y. This causes gales of laughter from the boys, one of whom takes Toshiie's sword and offers it to Algren. Algren looks at the sword in his hand and unthinkingly twirls if with a f1ourish -- causing the boys to applaud. Yoritomo bows, and encourages A1gren in Higen's direction. Algren shakes his head politely, but Higen is already on the attack. Algren dodges one thrust, then parries another, as the boys begin to cheer. Suddenly, ever yone goes silent. Algren turns. Ujio is standing behind him, arms folded. Ujio barks a command in Japanese. He wants Algren to drop the sword. It is obvious to Algren what it must mean, but he does nothing. Ujio approaches Algren slowl y. Algren holds the wooden sword casually, only his eyes betraying the tension of the moment. Ujio's wooden sword FLASHES, quicker than the eye can follow. Algren's sword is knocked from his hands, then, somehow in the same fluid movement, Ujio brings the sword around and cracks Algren across the chest hard enough to knock the breath from his body and lend him to his kneels. Satisfied with himself, Uji o starts to walk away, but the expressions of the bystanders cause him to turn back: . Algren is standing again, and again holding the sword. With grim purpose, Uji o returns to Algren, who has assumed a ready pose. Again Ujio's SWORD FLASHES. Algren manages to parry one blow, before he is cracked across the face, and blood begins to flow free1y from his nose.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Ujio knocks Algren's legs out from under him, and while Algren is sprawling on the ground, Ujio kicks Algren's sword out of his hand, and starts away. Again, Algren manages to stand up, and before Ujio can turn, charges him. But Uji o doesn't need to turn. In a sliding move, he dodges and cracks Algren in the side, then the legs, then the neck. Gasping for breath, at least one rib broken, Algren writhes on the ground. Ujio digs the point of his sword into Algren's hand until he releases his grip. Again Ujio kicks the sword away. The ever-enlarging crowd gasps as Algren once again struggles to his feet. This time without hesitation, Uji o runs back and rains blows upon Algren's now defenseless body. First the wrist, then the back, then the stomach, then finally the head. Algren hits the ground, unconscious, his fingers still clutching the sword. Ujio reaches down, pries it from his fingers, and breaks it across his knee. INT.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Algren lies painfully on a mat, his eyes unfocused. A sudden flash of memory: The lovel y blond woman, tears in her eyes, looks up to Algren's shining face, the epaulets on his crisp officer's, uniform gleaming gold in the sun. The reverie is broken. As Taka kneels to swab the cuts on his face. He stares at her darkly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . He stares at her for a moment, then knocks the soup out of her blinds. Her eyes FLASH for one moment, before resuming their usual mildness. But that flash is enough to satisfy him, and he calms down. She walks away. He sighs, exhausted, only to see her approach again with a new bowl. Their eyes meet, and hold for a moment. She does have a soul. He takes a sip. INT.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Who are you people anywa y? She makes no attempt to understand or respond.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You have no God, you have no mercy, you don't even have any fucking walls. Your walls are made of paper, what's the matter with you? She pushes his head aside so she can attend to his neck.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: This man tries to kill me and I've done nothing to him, and you, I kill your husband and you act like, what? Like I'm a guest in your house. What is wrong with you? This last said so intensely that she glances at him before picking up a bowl of soup she had brought for him, and bringing it to his lips...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Do you have a soul at all?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Algren is led past baldheaded monks into an ancient shrine. Katsumoto kneels before a small altar. He doesn't seem aware that Algren is present.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : The TWO OF THEM, hours later--
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Ujio is teaching you the wa y of the Japanese sword.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Is that what he's doing?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: At what age did you become I soldier?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Nineteen.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: To fight in your American civil war.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Tell me about that war'.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What about it?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Everything.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Everything about the civil war? Katsumoto sits impassively, staring at the altar.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That would take a year.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You have pressing business elsewhere? Shaking his head, Algren sits down.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The civil war began on April 12. 1861 when the rebs attacked Fort Sumter. Well, actually, it probabl y began three years earlier when the Supreme Court decided a runaway slave had to be returned to his master
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: --and Pickett says he wants to do it, over Longstreet's objections and Lee doesn't know what to think, but he lets him. So 15,000 men go up that hill. And most of them die.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Was that wise?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No, it was stupid.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Why?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The point of a battle is to win, or at least have enough men survive to fight another day.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You did not try to survive when we took you prisoner. Algren eyes him, frustrated.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What do you want from me?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What do you want for yourself?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You know they're not going to ransom me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We have little use for money.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (mounting fury) Then what are you doing, why are you asking me these questions, what is going on here?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The snows will melt in May, and the passes will open, and the events of the world will unfold. Until that time, you are here. (smiles) I enjoyed this conversation in your English. I hope you will honor me with more tomorrow. Katsumoto stands, bows, and leaves. INT.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Young Toshiie sits near Algren. He labors over a scroll with a brush, the gentle brush strokes are hypnotic as they sweep across the rice paper. Algren tries to indicate that he would like pen and paper for himself. Toshiie gives him what he asks. Algren begins to write:
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) Day unknown, month unknown, 1876. I continue to live among these strange people. EXT.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Katsumoto watches Ujio bark orders to the men he is training. A sudden Movement of their eyes, causes Uji o to stop. He turns to find: Algren standing at the end of the line, holding I wooden sword. An almost imperceptible look passes bet ween Ujio and Katsumoto, but Ujio's Resentment is over-ruled. Without a word, he continues. Algren does his best to follow the exercise. Katsumoto, the slightest hint of a smile on his face, walks away.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) Each day I am confounded by their strange customs and contradictions, savagery followed by mildness. INT.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Algren now kneels at the table with the rest of the family as they eat. He is in considerable pain from the rigors of training. He tries to roll the stiffness out of his neck, when be notices that Higen it imitating him. Toshiie laughs.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) They seem to value nothing more than their families, and yet they kill defenseless wounded men without a shade of remorse.. Yoritomo sternly tells Higen not to make fun of their guest. Yoritomo apologizes to Algren, who shakes his head unnecessary.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: .                           Raisu? [Rice?] They stop, shocked. He has spoken! Yoritomo calls for Taka to serve him more rice, then begins yammering enthusiastically in Japanese. Algren holds up his hand.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Not so fast Ko...toba? [Words?] (bolds up chopsticks) What is this?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hashi.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hashi. Yoritomo is hysterical with glee now.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hail! The boys are suddenly dervishes, pulling various objects from the table and around the room, shouting the Japanese words for each. Algren shakes his head, and smiles for the first time in this stor y. Yoritomo manages to quiet the boys. He points to himself.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yoritomo.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (points to himself) Algren.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: All-gren. Algren nods, and the boys start screaming "All-gren!"
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (points to each in rum) Higen. Toshiie. Taka.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (bowing) Higen. Toshiie. (turns to Taka) Taka. She meets his eyes for the slightest moment, then looks down and walks away. INT.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Katsumoto is arranging flowers. Algren watches in confusion, as this powerful lord goes about doing something so feminine and delicate. Finally:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: it. ........Yes, I was a member of the government. I helped restore the Emperor to the throne.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: The parliament of your country has two houses. Why is that?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: To keep either one from being too powerful.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Does not a people need a powerful ruler to protect them?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We believe the opposite. Katsumoto thinks about this.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I have a question. How do you come to speak English?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Members of the Council were required to study ............
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: So that Japan could have a powerful ruler to protect it. Katsumoto understands Algren's irony, but doesn't smile.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: And now you must hate him for what he's done.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He is my blood. I serve him with my life.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: By fighting his army? Katsumoto looks at A1gren.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I do not fight the emperor. I fight those who seek to influence him, those who betray the soul of my country. He slowl y draws his long samurai sword, and places it next to the flowers on the table in front of him.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The Emperor gave this blade to my ancestors
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: years ago. It has been used only to defend his sacred honor. Katsumoto hands the sword to Algren. Algren studies it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It takes many years to make a sword. It is a holy Act. A samurai's sword is his soul.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: This sword is flawed. What is this uneven line near the edge? Katsumoto smiles at Algren's ignorance.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: One man is flexible and compromises too much to avoid conflict. Another man is so fierce he wins ever y battle, but so rigid he can never know peace. A man who knows both is the perfect warrior. The lame is true of a blade .. one steel bends, and the other cuts. And where they meet is never perfect Hold the blade up. . Algren holds the sword, cutting edge up. Katsumoto takes a silk cloth and drops it. It gently billows down -- and splits evenly on the edge.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Some believe a blade is thirsty until it tastes the blood of its enemy. Algren hands the sword back. Suddenly, Katsumoto swings the sword, cleanly splitting the table in two. Silence.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The crew at Winchester can produce one rifle ever y seven minutes.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We gave up firearms two hundred years ago. It takes no courage to kill. A man from half a mile awa y. You must look into the eyes of your enemy to know who you have killed.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm not sure an artillery officer would agree.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Do you?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I think all killing's a filthy business.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Taking a man's life is nothing. It is his honor you can never take awa y.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: In other words you have no respect for human life.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (fierce) . What do you know of human life? You come here to kill for money Where is your family? Where is your wife, your sons? What is your legacy?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (undaunted) And what is yours? To rebel against the future? I fought the South in our civil war. Their leaders believed they were fighting for "honor" just as you do. And their people died by the thousands! Katsumoto simply looks at him.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: And my wife is dead.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Mine, too. They look at each other. Some unexpected recognition has taken place.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Tomorrow we will discuss your country's wish for dominance in the..."Far East."
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: ...I look forward to it. Algren turns to go. EXT.VILLAGE SQUARE DAY We see the village swordsmith at work. He has been forging the same long samurai blade for months... Algren watches him as he works.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) March 9. 1877. I have never known such a disciplined people. EXT. VILLAGE DAY Algren trains with the other men. He attempts an attack, which is easily brushed aside by Nakao. Algren ends up in the dirt again.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) From the moment they wake, they devote themselves to the perfection of whatever they pursue-- EXT. VILLAGEDAY Algren walking with Katsumoto -- they are deep in conversation.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) And yet the more time I spend here, the less I understand them. EXT.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Two women are bowing repeatedly, chattering in smiling, earnest argument.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) Everyone is polite, every nuance of behavior seems to have a great meaning, and increasingly I am convinced that the lower they bow, the leas they mean it. EXT.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Algren, holding the wooden sword in 1870'5 baseball manner, is coaxing Higen to throw the ball at him. The children laugh as Algren hits it onto the next porch. Taka watches her sons impassively. It is dear how much they like Algren.
direction.name: direction

result.heading: ICE CRYSTAL ON THE END OF A BRANCH

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) And I am sure they regard my wa ys to be as confounding and unfathomable as I find theirs. AN ICE CRYSTAL ON THE END OF A BRANCH Starts to drip. SPRING bas begun. BXT.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Villagers laugh as they go about the business of life. A man throws a sack of rice to another. Two women hurry awa y from a farmer who is teasing them. Algren is once again among the training warriors. He and another man face off, each waiting for the other to attack with his wooden sword.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Algren moves first, but his opponent counters, and strikes him easily. They wheel around and engage again, and again Algren is bested. Furious, he throws himself at his opponent, reverting to classic saber technique. In a flurry of movement, his opponent manages to deflect the blows and also knock Algren to his knees. Yoritomo approaches and bows.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . A heavy ceiling beam breaks loose, threatens to crush Toshiie Algren dives forward, grabs Toshiie and pulls him out of the wa y... the front of the house collapses, the beams smashing to the ground.. Taka and Higen race to Algren and Toshiie. The boy is safe. Taka grabs the child and cradles him. Her look to Algren is fierce, protective, almost feral -- as if he were the threat instead of the rescuer. EXT.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) I am str    uck by these people and their acceptance of Fate in a1l it   s variations. At a time like this, they seem utterly without      sentiment. Even the children have a gravity beyond      their years. Algren goes to them. Silently begins to help them. INT.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: A1gren -San. Please forgive. Too many mind.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (pointing as he explains) Mind sword, mind face, mind people watch, too many mind. (on Algren's confused expression) No mind.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No mind?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hai! No mind. You try. Algren nods, uncertainly, and picks himself up. Again he faces the opponent, shaking off the tension and trying to stay calm. This time the opponent charges first, and Algren manages to parry one blow, before he is again bested. Yoritomo bows happily and begins yammering in Japanese, clearly taking credit for Algren's progress. Across the square, Katsumoto watches. EXT.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The cherry blossoms have emerged, creating a scene of intense col or, beauty, and serenity. The Emperor sits cross-legged next to a shrine. He is approached by Omura and two other advisors.                                                                        .
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Your majest y, beg permission to approach. (the Emperor nods) Your humble servants are most anxious to know if his Majest y has signed the order regarding the railroad progress.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (after a long moment) I am most impressed at the wa y the blossoms float upon the air, as if held by unseen hands.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes, they represent the highest form of gyoko. About the order, your Majest y.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: This railroad must go through Yoshino Province?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It is absolutely necessar y your Highness.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: If you sa y so, I shall sign. EXT.
