dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Algren walks through the village, past the swordsmith who is now honing the blade, carefully sharpening it. .EXT.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Algren makes his way through a stunning cherry forest near the village. The pink and red blossoms are dazzling and abundant. Other villagers can be seen gathering cherry bl ossoms. It is a place of otherworldly beaut y. It is all so beautiful that Algren just stops. Takes it in for a moment. He reaches out and touches a blossom.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) A perfect blossom is a rare thing... Algren turns. Katsumoto is kneeling nearby, meditating.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You could spend your life looking for one. And it would not be a wasted life.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Were you praying?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Just sitting... I do not think I have the word. Satori it means, maybe, awareness.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Of what?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: This moment alone, apart from all others ... You know this? (Algren shakes his head) I am writing a poem about this time we hive spent. I have only written one line on "His eyes were like my own but seen through a deep and troubled ocean." Can you suggest a second line?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm not much of a writer.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Is this why you spend so much time with your journal?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: How do you know that? (no answer) She told you. Katsumoto appraises Algren.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Did you love her husband as your own son?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You have sent men to their deaths, just as I have.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The difference is, you feel nothing.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Before you were a soldier, you were a farmer.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What does that have to do with anything?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You lived on a farm. Or in a forest of trees.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: How do you know?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The wa y you look at the cherry blossoms.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (reluctantly) We lived in a place called Connecticut. My...brother and I climbed the maple trees.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Were they beautiful?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: And you were sad to see them die in the winter. A beat. Something flickers in Algren's eyes.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You were something before you were a soldier. You were a boy who was sad to see the leaves fall and the trees die. Katsumoto looks at him deepl y.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Like those trees, we are all dying. The future is an illusion, our plans are an illusion, our fears an illusion. We live life in every breath. Eat, drink, fuck. Now. Every cup of tea. Every word we write... Every blossom we hold. He smiles sadly.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Every life we take. A beat. He stands, takes in the beautiful cherry orchard.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Life in every breath. That is bushido. The wa y of the samurai. He goes. Algren stands for a moment deep in thought INT.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Algren is asleep. And then we note that the ground is vibrating .. he slides across his mat .- wakes with a start An unholy rumbling- Algren bolts up ... just as a paper wall rips open, the wooden framework to the room splits and the roof collapses-- An earthquake. Common for this part of Japan. EXT.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yoritomo appears. He and Algren crawl out of the house just as the ground lurches violently- Part of the house contorts and caves in Around the village, the wooden frame houses are swa ying and lurching they have some torque, but not enough Ujio directs the villagers as they battle a fire- Taka appears, calling frantically for Toshiie. Then an even larger seismic tremor suddenly TEARS THROUGH THE VILLAGE Houses are ripped apart -- the whole world shifting. Though the smoke, Algren sees Toshiie cowering under an eave
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Algren watches the villagers rebuild. Yoritomo and Higen strugg1e with a large wooden framework.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Algren works with Yoritomo, binding the wooden framework. Higen prepares the paper walls nearby. He does this with considerable skill. Taka is getting water from a rain barrel she observes Algren helping rebuild her home. Yoritomo is working nearby. Algren's Japanese is rough but improving:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Katsumoto himself plays the lead role. An enthusiastic actor, he plays to the children in the audience. They are delighted with his broad theatrics. INT. YORITOMO'S HOUSE Taka is carrying in a huge lack of rice. Algren goes to help her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (insistent) Hai. He carries the rice for her into the pantry area.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (softl y) Hai. They look at each other for a long moment. She starts to move, but he stops her. They are close enough to smell each other's hair, to feel the warmth of the other's breath. She looks up at him, pleading with her eyes not to take this any further. 60. He lets her go. EXT.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (in Japanese, subtitles) Would last longer ... if stone.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (subtitles) No. House fall. House go back easy with wood. Algren shakes his head. Taka appears with cups of water. Algren looks at her For the first rime, she holds his gaze. EXT.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Torches illuminate a small stage in the center of the village square. Several samurai perform a ritualistic Noh drama. (A form which, by the wa y, the samurai invented.) Others play flutes and large steel drums.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) And yet I have never seen a people with more capacity for the joy found in the simplest things of life.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (subtitles) No, please.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (subtitles) Japanese men do not help with this.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (subtitles) I know. She looks at him, a little surprised.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (subtitles) I am not Japanese. In spite of herself, she smiles a little. There is an awkward moment.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (subtitles)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: ... didn't know he was your husband.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (struck; subtitles) He did his duty. You did your duty.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (subtitles) And you do yours.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Algren stands across from Ujio, ready again for the ken-jutso. They stand frozen for a long time, hands on the hilts of their wooden swords. Other samurai watch. Algren and Ujio stare at each other. But there is something different about Algren's expression. Not as much fury and competition, more a sense of balance and alertness. He studies Ujio's eyes, his hands, the folds of his kimono, the attitude of his body. We watch A1gren closel y. Gradually all SOUND drains away. We hear only Algren's steady breathing. He is aware of everything. A bird in a tree. A woman grinding rice. A plum about to fall. A gently swa ying battle flag, Slow-motion as: Algren attacks -- no fury, just control-- Ujio tries to deflect the blow, Algren anticipates - he swings his sword elegantly - -Ujio blocks it -- Algren counters -- Algren presses forward, his sword slashing masterfully, forcing Ujio back Ujio counters with complex moves as he retreats --Algren keeps moving forward, calm -- finally Ujio's sword is swept aside in one clean movement. Algren ends with the edge of his wooden sword It Ujio's throat. The other samurai watch. Amazed. Algren twirls his sword in a fancy cavalry "fl ourish." The pride he has alwa ys taken in his swordsmanship has been restored. He bows to Uji o. Ujio nods his head, slightly, in respect The other samurai, led by the hearty Nakao, congratulate Algren. EXT. MEADOW                            DAY Algren carries water from the river through a riot of spring wild-flowers. Something makes him stop, and see the sunlit clouds in the deep blue sky, the colors around him, hear the buzzing of the bees, feel the kill of the air. A sudden flash of memory His beautiful wife, in green field not unlike this one, laughing, tossing her hair, falling back into the long grass. Back to Algren
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . The force of the memory causes him to link to the ground. Another flash of memory, longer this time: His wi fe leans over and kisses his mouth, and his cheek, and his forehead. He holds her al tightly as be can. Back to Algren As tears begin to course down his face, and he sinks down into the flowers and the grass, looking up into the impossibl y beautiful sky. He gives in to the sobs wracking his body. EXT.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As Algren returns with the water, he sees Katsumoto approaching with Ujio and several warriors.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: The Emperor has requested my presence. We leave tomorrow. You will be released in Tokyo. He goes. Algren stands, not sure how to react. INT.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Algren writes on parchment by the light of an oil lamp.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) April 13, 1877. Tomorrow we return to civilization. As eager as I am to be among my own kind, I confess to a curious reluctance. EXT.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Algren stands overlooking the village as the sun rises over the misty peaks.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) These months have marked me, and I don't fully know yet wh y. EXT.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Algren prepares to mount up. Yoritomo says goodbye to his family.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . EXT.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) I do know it is here that I have known my first untroubled sleep in many years. Taka comes to Algren, bows her head.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (subtitles) You are alwa ys welcome in our home.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Domo Arrigato. He glances at the unfinished house.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (subtitles) ...You will finish it soon.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (subtitles) If that is my destiny. She bows her head again. Toshiie hands him a scroll: it is a picture of the Family. Algren is included. Japanese characters list all their names. Toshiie bows. Algren bows and tucks the scroll into his coat. Algren and Yoritomo move out with Katsumoto, Ujio, Nakao and his bodyguard of several dozen Samurai. The villagers bow and honor the warrior as they pass. EXT.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Algren trots alongside Katsumoto.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: ... The Emperor sends a message for you to return to Tokyo, and you go?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Even though you're in rebellion against him.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Against the Emperor? Never. I serve him. As I have alwa ys done.    .
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I don't understand.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Our Emperor is young, and there are things I must sa y to him.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: But ever yone around him wants you dead.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: And if the Emperor desires, I will take my own life at his command. He spurs his horse and rides on. A1gren watches him.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: They approach a large inn. A boy working in the fields see Katsumoto approaching. He doesn't believe it -- the Great Katsumoto. He drops his hoe and races awa y, calling out.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: We will stop here for the night. EXT.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Samurai guards have been posted around the perimeter. INT.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Algren is escorted in. Katsumoto kneels at a table. Preparing the traditional Japanese tea ceremony.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . They were then known as Shinobi, masters of stealth and spying. We know them as Ninjas. They float across the ground ... creeping an inch ever y hour... complete physica1 control. One black-gloved finger moves. Then the next... They crawl and then wait Poised on their fingertips and toes. There is no sound as they strike. The samurai guards are garroted in an instant. Other Ninjas catch the samurai's weapons as they fall. No sound disturbs the peaceful night. EXT.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Sit, Captain. Algren sits. By now he has learned how to sit on the ground. Katsumoto begins the exacting, delicate and precise tea ceremony.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Do you drink tea?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I've had little else for some time... Katsumoto continues with the tea ceremony.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: How's your poem coming?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I am having trouble. The truth is I am not a very good poet. (Algren smiles) Do you know wh y you were sent here? To Yoshino.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: To protect the railroad.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Why is the railroad here?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: So Tokyo can control the whole country.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You have seen my province. All mountains. Far from Tokyo. Yet the rail line must come here? Katsumoto tosses a tiny bit of coal on the simmering brazier on the table. Algren watches carefully.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You have something they want
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What do they want in my mountains?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Minerals ... Gold.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (smiles) There is no gold in Japan. Katsumoto gently blows on the coal brazier. The coal flares a bit.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Coal? (Katsumoto looks at him) For steamships.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: And why would steamships be so important?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: ...China. Katsumoto looks up at him. Impressed.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Japan has nothing. China has ever ything.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Mine the coal to create a way station for the trip to China ... Freeze the Europeans out and Japan and America have a monopol y on the China trade.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Add to this the Omura Zaibatsu. You know the Zaibatus?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The wealthy families.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: As patron of the railroad, Omura owns all land within four hundred feet of ever y new rail line. As my country grows, so will his wealth. (looks at him) This is why you are fighting. Katsumoto completes the tea ceremony. He pours a cup for Algren. Bows his head and offers it to him.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: And you will tell the emperor to stop them?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I do not tell the emperor what to do.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Then what do you hope to accomplish? Katsumoto looks at Algren, the slightest gleam in his eye.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Will you return to America? Algren watches him -- why didn't Katsumoto answer?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: ...I have a job here.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You should return to your home.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Why?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Because I do not wish you to be m y enemy again. Katsumoto returns to his poem, he does not look up.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Go home Captain ... Anshinritsumai. I wish you peace. Algren waits but Katsumoto just continues to work on his poem. EXT.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The samurai guards are alert, their senses heightened to almost superhuman proportions. But there is another way. Another way of learning combat. A wa y without the beaut y, the philosophy and the moral code. They are almost imperceptible at first... their head-to-toe black clothes a perfect camouflage... their silence and stealth are otherworldly.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Silence. Two samurai guards are in position. One of them glances up at the stars. A Ninja throwing star instantly slices into his jugular-- blood sprays -- the other guard turns  a series of Ninja slice into him... EXT.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Silence. The Ninjas use mew claws to crawl up the walls like spiders. EXT.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Silence. A samurai guard stands at the edge of the roof. A Ninja silently moves toward him. Stops. Ten feet awa y. He pulls out a shuriken -- a small needle-shaped projectile, dips it into a sack of poison. Places it carefully into the palm of his hand. And with the flick of his wrist-- The needle flies -- stabbing into the samurai -- he crumples. Other Ninjas immediately pour over the edge of the roof -- catching the samurai before he falls... INT.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Katsumoto cannot sleep. He stares out the window at a nightingale. INT.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Silence. Ujio sits in his room. He is unblinking. Alert. Swords at the ready. INT.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . More Ninjas drop from the rafters on ropes. INT.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Then, just as a Ninja it about to kill Algren, Katsumoto FLINGS his short sword ... it pin-wheels across the room, hitting Algren's attacker in the chest. Without missing a beat, Algren pulls the short sword from the dying Ninja's chest and uses it to stab another Ninja who, thinking Algren defenseless, has launched an attack. INT.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Silence.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Silence. Algren cannot sleep either. He sits leaning against a wall. Thinking. INT.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Silence. Yoritomo drinks tea with Nakao, the huge martial arts master. INT.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: A guard stands sentinel. Above his head, unbeknownst to him, two Ninjas descend on ropes. One of them swings a long chain - to which I barbed-knife is attached. As it lodges in the guard's chest, the second Ninja swings down just in time to catch the dead guard, silently, before his body hits the ground. INT.
dialogue.name: dialogue

result.heading: TEARING STRAIGHT THROUGH THE PAPER WALL,

dialogue.raw_text: Silence. Katsumoto lies in bed listening to the night bird. It stops singing. Katsumoto smiles sadly. He decides to give up on sleep, leans forward to rise. This act saves his life. For when the Ninjas come, they come all at once-- A Ninja suddenly comes TEARING STRAIGHT THROUGH THE PAPER WALL, his sword slashing down .- just missing Katsumoto. Katsumoto calls out an alarm, diving and rolling across the floor for his sword. He instantly kills one Ninja using his steel-tipped "war fan" to slash his attackers throat. Another smashes in through the window. INT.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Ninjas EXPLODE into the main hall. Samurai who come out of their rooms are cut down by a variety of weapons -- one takes a throwing star in the face, others are felled by the traditional ninja-to, short swords ideal for fighting in confined spaces, chain-knives, nun-chaka and others.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Ninja SMASHES through the paper wall -- Algren grabs the nearest object, a low tea table. and swings it at his head. The Ninja dodges the blow and slices at Algren with short-sword. Algren barely avoids the blow by ducking behind a post as the sword LODGES deep in the wood. Algren flings himself, bodily, at his attacker. INT.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Ninja throwing stars spin across the room, killing a samurai. Yoritomo emerges from his room, readying his bow, but the dead samurai falls back blocking his wa y. From behind the rice wall, Yoritomo lets fly an arrow without even looking. It passes THROUGH the wall, killing the Ninja on the opposite balcony. INT.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Ujio screams a war cry and begins to battle his way up the stairs. With breathtaking moves, he slashes hands and limbs, forcing the Ninja back. Nakao fights his wa y up beside him, desperately trying to reach Katsumoto's room. Using only his bare hands he catches a Ninja's wrist and hurls him over the railing. INT.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Algren and the Ninja are in a death struggle, kneeing, gouging, butting. They awkwardly smash through a paper wall into the next room. INT.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Katsumoto wields his long sword in one hand and his short sword in the other. It is the first time we have seen him in action and his movements are both beautiful and deadly. But more Ninjas are pouring in through the window, threatening to overwhelm him. INT.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Rolling on the ground, Algren manages to grab a chopstick and STAB his adversary through the eye. He picks up the fallen short sword and steps out into the hall. ARROWS whiz past, thudding into the wall beside his head. INT.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Katsumoto, breathing heavily, his kimono shredded and bloody, is fending off the Ninjas' increasingly savage attacks as Algren enters. Algren SCREAMS, distracting them just long enough for Katsumoto to take advantage and kill one.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Ujio and Nakao are back to back, a perfect fighting machine as they fight their wa y to Katsumoto's rescue. They battle Ninjas wielding lethal kusarigamas, the Ninjas swing chains, the attached blades slice the air--Nakao catches the chains and flinging the Ninja over the balcony. INT.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Yoritomo is pinned down. Darts and throwing stars shred the rice paper wall above him. He picks off another Ninja before changing his position. INT.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . INT.
direction.name: direction

result.heading: HIS LITILE FINGER IS CHOPPED OFF
TO TIE HIS HAND TO HIS SWORD

dialogue.raw_text: The blazing sword battle continues. Algren throws a beautiful painted standing-screen in front of an attacking Ninja, momentarily confusing him. Then he stabs THROUGH THE SCREEN -as a blood- stain SPREADS across the pastoral painting. But another Ninja catches Algren off-guard and slices at him with his short sword. As Algren lifts his sword to parry the blow, HIS LITILE FINGER IS CHOPPED OFF. He drops the sword, momentarily defenseless. Across the hallway Yoritomo has been watching the shadowpla y on the rice-paper walls. Algren's attacker raises his blade to deliver the death blow. In Katsumoto's room Algren flinches involuntarily beneath the raised blade. Suddenly the Ninja JACKKNIFES as if punched by an unseen hand. As he spins, dead, to the ground, we SEE an ARROW lodged bet ween his shoulder blades. Yoritomo has FIRED blindly, through the wall killing Algren's attacker. Nearby, a Ninja hurls a throwing star at Katsumoto. With blind instinct Katsumoto turns and takes the blade in the meat of his arm. Algren, meanwhile, has ripped the sleeve of his kimono into a tourniquet for his maimed hand. He uses the rest of the fabric TO TIE HIS HAND TO HIS SWORD before launching himself back into the fray -- slicing an attacker just as he is about to impale Katsumoto. Together, he and Katsumoto force the last two Ninjas through a paper wall to the next room. They fight all the wa y through that room and BLAST through another paper wall to the next.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The battle continues unabated on the stairs -- the Ninjas spring for position with incredible grace --perching and fighting on banisters, leaping from one level to the next. It is a mayhem of flashing swords and flailing limbs and flyi ng arrows and spinning Ninja stars. Sprays of blood splatter against the white rice paper walls. Some of the fighting is less than elegant. Men bite and wrestle and gouge to survive in close quarters. All of them arc bloody and sweat y and dirty and tired, heaving for breath, their skin flayed open, their kimonos ripped, their hands and arms and faces blood-stained. But more samurai reinforcements follow Ujio up the stairs: Together with Yoritomo and Nakao, they have begun to gain the upper hand. Ujio flings both his swords through the air -- killing two Ninjas -- and dives to fight others - his martial arts skills are dazzling. Algren and Katsumoto are fighting sidc by side And we cut to -- EXT.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Outside of the inn, we slowl y pull away... The sounds of the battle gradually fade... Soon it is nothing more than a lovel y rustic inn nestled in the mountains. INT.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . EXT.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Later. The battle is over. Ninja and samurai corpses litter the inn. We slowl y move up the long stairwa y from the bottom... Yoritomo pulls a Ninja star from Nakao's_shou1der. Then one from his own. We move up another level, past more bodies... Ujio moves through the Ninjas. Making sure they are dead. Before sheathing his sword, he angrily FLICKS it at the rice paper wall, spattering it with the bloody spray. Katsumoto wipes his sword on a nearby corpse, replaces it in its sheath. He sits beside Algren on a stair. Both men are exhausted. Bloodied. Alive. A long beat as we watch the two warriors. Slow fade to...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Algren, Katsumoto and the others are nearing the palace. Algren slows to a stop -- his path is toward the city. Katsumoto stops, looks at him, then does something absolutel y extraordinary. He kneels and bows before Algren. Quickly touching his head to the dirt. Then he rises, turns and walks toward the palace. Algren stands, stunned. EXT.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Algren walks onto the parade ground. The change he sees could not be more remarkable. Thousands of new Japanese troops are drilling with new bolt-action Mausers. They are precise, exact and frighteningly mechanistic, their uniforms new and crisp. New German advisors are barking commands. Colonel Bagley sees him.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Algren? My God, you never cease to astonish. Bagley runs over, hand extended, but Algren turns to look at the troops.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: They have new weapons.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The Kaiser was only too happy to help. Along with his friends at Mauser and Krupp. Thank God we Americans still have a few teeth in our head. And they come to the "teeth." Howitzer cannons. A row of them. Artillery officers in US Army uniforms arc instructing Japanese offi cers.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The ambassador and I have spent eight months kissing Omura's ass so he'll sign the damn trade pact with us. You spent all this time living with those savages? (A1gren looks at him) He's going to want to talk to you...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I need a bath.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: And your back pay, I imagine. Algren starts walking away.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: They got their flag. ...See? And we see it... snapping on I flagpole high above the parade ground. It is immediately familiar. A red circle on a white field. The Rising Sun. The Howitzers fire in sequence. Thundering blasts that shake the heavens. EXT,
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Omura stands above Emperor Meiji respectful but persistent. The Emperor is kneeling, tending to his iris garden. It is one of the wonders of the Palace: a sea of white, pink, blue, and purple blossoms. Retainers and servants stand at a distance. One holds a standard with the Imperial seal: a yellow chrysanthemum. Omura sees Katsumoto making his way toward them. He talks a bit more quickly to the Emperor. Katsumoto begins to prostrate himself before the Emperor, the usual sign of extreme respect -- but the Emperor stops him:
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (subtitles) No, Mori-san. We arc "civilized" now. Katsumoto stops prostrating himself. The Emperor offers his hand.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (subtitles) I cannot touch the Sacred One.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (subtitles) You can. It is a difficult moment for Katsumoto. He simply cannot do It.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (subtitles) Did you have a pleasant journey, Minister Katsumoto?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (subtitles) It was uneventful. Omura appreciates Katsumoto's droll response. He assumes that Katsumoto is aware of his part in the assassination attempt.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (subtitles) If it is not a great imposition. I desire a moment alone with Minister Katsumoto. Omura-San.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (subtitles) Enlightened One, perhaps I can be of service in a conversation of state.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (subtitles) So kind of you, but I fear my old teacher wishes to upbraid me in private for neglecting my studies. Omura bows his head quickly and goes. Silence. The Emperor gazes at Katsumoto. Then:
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (subtitles) You rise against me, my teacher.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (subtitles) No, Highness, I rise against your enemies.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (subtitles) They are my teacher, my advisers, like you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (subtitles) They advise in their own interest.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (subtitles) The world is changing, Mori -- you have not seen what goes on beyond our borders, the inventions, the science. I need men who can look outward, or soon we will be left behind, and defenseless.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (subtitles) I am sworn to defend you even to my last breath.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (subtit1es) The samurai live in the past. You cannot defend against a future you don't understand.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (subtitles) If I am no use, then I will happily end my life,
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (subtitles) No, Mori. It is my wish that you rejoin the Council of State. I need your voice.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (subtitles) It is your voice that needs to be heard, Highness. You are a living God, you can do what ever you think is right. The young emperor is silent a moment.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (subtitles) I am a living God only as long as I do what they think is right.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (subtitle) Your Highness, may I beg forgiveness for saying what a teacher must, that such a statement is pathetic drivel not worthy of an ignorant stable boy, let alone a young man I know to have some modest intelligence. The emperor laughs warmly, almost happy to be scolded as he once was.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (subtitles) Is it possible a living God can be too afraid to make his voice heard? (Katsumoto's look is not unkind) Tell me what to do, Mori-San?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (subtitles) You are emperor, my Lord, not me. You must find the wisdom for all of us. EXT.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: A series of warehouses, beyond which we see warships in the harbor. A1gren walks with Bagley and two other OFFICERS. INT.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: The cavernous warehouse piled high with huge crates.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: As soon as they sign the agreement, they're obligated to buy the entire weapons package, from Colt revol vers to Ha1liwell twelve-pounders. Plus this particular item you might recognize. A few stevedores tear open one of the crates. Algren hides his astonishment: A Gatling Gun is revealed.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: They've been calibrated to fire 200 rounds a minute, The new copper cartridges cut down on jamming. Algren closes his eyes, trying to keep his memories at bay. EXT.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Algren fights the crowds with Colonel Bagley And Ambassador Swanbeck..
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) May 15, 1877. The city I return to is immeasurabl y changed New construction ever ywhere. Telegraph wires strung next to an ancient temple. A modern European hotel is going up, dwarfing the traditional Japanese buildings. Huge billboards advertising Western goods. A new invention, the rickshaw, has replaced many of the palanquins.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) As though Tokyo were determined to become another New York or Chicago .- all in one headlong rush. Spider's web of telegraph cables spread from a tall new brick building. It is like a New York office building stabbing into the heart of old Japan. The familiar Omura character is emblazoned on the side. .INT.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Aside from the occasional bit of Japanese decor, this could be a buzzing Wall Street firm. Telegraph operators click away. Accountants use adding machines. Secretaries use pneumatic tubes to send documents back and forth. Engineers plot out railway lines. All are dressed in Western clothes. Algren, Colonel Bagley, and Ambassador Swanbeck enter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . An anteroom holds waiting delegations from the various European powers. A babel of language. ... French ...Dutch ...Russian ...German. A pretty American secretary looks up from her desk.
direction.name: direction

result.ToD: OFFICES OF THE OMURA ZAIBATSU DAY
result.heading: OFFICES OF THE OMURA ZAIBATSU DAY

dialogue.raw_text: (to Algren) If he asks, you can talk about ordnance and tactics. But remember, this has to do with a lot more than just weapons.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Ambassador Swanbeck, if you'll follow me. Some of the delegates arc craning forward, watching Algren and the others hungrily as they head into the final office. INT.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Omura stands like an industrial titan before large picture windows offering a dramatic view of Tokyo. The only decoration in the room is an enormous Caravaggio.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . EXT.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . EXT.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thought I'd missed you. Were you going to leave without even saying goodbye? ALGREN I have a fear of sentimental Englishmen. GRAHAM You sod. (trying to keep up) Christ, give us. . second here Algren indicates for the bearer to stop. Graham tries to catch his breath. GRAHAM You're making a mistake, I promise you. Katsumoto's under house arrest, Omura's made his move -- he'll need you more than ever -- Graham stops, sees the look on Algren's face, realizes. GRAHAM Oh, my goodness. How silly of me.. All that time you were with him, up in those mountains, ..................................   ...I told you they were a remarkable people... Algren doesn't answer, but isn't denying it either. GRAHAM Then you should get out. Because Omura will become rather impatient with anyone who isn't on the team. Graham notices Algren staring at his followers. GRAHAM Case in point. ALGREN Who are they? GRAHAM Ronin would be m y guess. Disgraced samurai doing odd jobs for his Nibs. 87.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Please, sit down, gentlemen. Omura removes a gold cigarette case and lights up. Cigarettes are the newest Western fad Sweeping Japan.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (re: cigarette case) A gift from Czar Alexander... Captain Algren,. it seems you have endured your captivity with little ill-effect.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes, sir.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He's an extraordinary man, isn't he?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He is samurai. Omura gazes at him. Slowl y takes I puff from his cigarette.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Mr. Omura, my people have been drawing up the documents we discussed. I have a draft--
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We're not quite ready to announce the treaty, Ambassador.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Excuse me?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The Emperor is...sentimental. Katsumoto was his old mentor-- he is not eager to offend him. It will take I few more days.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: How many da ys is " a few?"
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I assure you the Samurai will not stand in the wa y of our agreement. You are prepared to make deliver y?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Soon as your emperor signs on the dotted line.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Captain Algren you are the expert. Will this array of ordnance be sufficient?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Depends on what you're trying to accomplish.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I want my country to take its place as a modern power.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Then they will set you well on your way.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I am pleased.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Mr. Omura, you assured us you had the influence with your emperor to make this deal come to pass. With all due respect perhaps there is someone else we should be speaking to.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: With all due respect, Ambassador, perhaps there is someone else we should be speaking to, for instance the French. Or the English. Or any of the legations waiting in the next room. Ambassador Swan beck stands swallowing his rage.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes, we1l, we look forward to hearing from you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Good afternoon, gentlemen. They start to go.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Captain Algren, perhaps you can stay a moment And tell me of your experiences in our rebellious provinces. Bagley looks at Algren. Do as he asks. He leaves A1gren alone with Omura.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Cigarette?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Thank you. Omura lights his cigarette. A moment as he takes Algren's measure.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You fought bravely on behalf of our army-- against the rebel Katsumoto. Algren says nothing.                            .
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: And yet you helped save his life when attacked by the Ninja.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: My role was much less significant than you may have heard.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Tell me about your role in Katsumoto's plans.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I have none.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: And your sympathies?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Again, I have none.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I know you have little sympathy for Colonel Bagley.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He is.... unsympathetic. Omura smiles.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I thought it was we who are inscrutable. Now it is Algren who smiles.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You have gained important knowledge of Katsumoto's province, his army, and his rebellion. This is extremely valuable to me. He watches Algren to see how this lands.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You also possess significant knowledge of m y army, my weaponry, and my plans. This is extremely va1uable to Katsumoto.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Again, you flatter me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No. I am a businessman. I recognize what is valuable. And I buy it. (looks at him) In this case, I value your loyalt y. Algren considers the implications of what Omura is saying.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I didn't know loyalt y was something that could be sold.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Then perhaps you will give it, as a token of future friendship - for which, as a friend, I would be in your debt.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (stands) Then I will consider it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: And I will be grateful. INT.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Algren is in a shipping office. A clerk consults his schedule of departure.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: All righteee, the ANDREW JACKSON leaves tomorrow if you want a steamship you'll have to wait six weeks. (Algren is silent) Gets ya to Frisco by the 28th. 14 dollars for a private cabin, 8 for a shared or 3 for a lower berth. What can I put you down for? Algren is silent, concentrating on a calendar hanging behind the clerk. It features a beautiful Hiroshigi watercolor of mountains.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Sir..?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (after a moment) Private cabin.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Graham walks with Algren.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Leave? Wh y would you leave now? No white man has ever been in your position. Do you have any idea what it will mean to have Omura as your friend? You want land, you want women, you want boys? Algren starts to walk faster, but Graham Stops him.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Nathan. I wanted to leave, too. For three years. You must believe me there is a majest y about these people -- can you imagine what your own country would be if it had half the drive and the discipline and the belief and the bravery of these ridiculous little people? Then raised voices from across the street stop them. They see Yoritomo surrounded by four Imperial Army soldiers. The soldiers are rough and imperious, drunk with power. They carry gleaming rifle.. The soldiers bark orders. Yoritomo stands proudly, responding calmly.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Whit is this?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: My God, it's the edicts...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What edicts? Algren arrives as the situation is clearly growing volatile - the soldiers are pointing to Yoritomo's head, screaming Algren steps toward the soldiers--
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That's enough-- One of the soldiers SCREAMS at him -- raises his rifle -- all the soldiers raise their rifles Yoritomo reaches for his sword -- Algren tries to push through - 81.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (subtitles)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: ! One of the soldiers smacks Algren in the chin with a rifle butt. Algren reels, and by the time he stands straight again, four others are pointing their ba yonets at his face. Graham takes hold of Algren's arm.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Don't be stupid. Algren makes eye contact with Yoritomo, who -- in deference to his friend -- puts his sword away. The Japanese soldiers continue to scream at Yoritomo. They force him to his knees. Rifles pressed to his head. Yoritomo bows his bead, speaking quietly, as if praying. Algren witches in horror all one of the soldiers removes his bayonet -- another grab. Yoritomo's hair, jerks his head back and begins hacking off Yoritomo's traditional top-knot of hair. Brutally. Blood. Yoritomo remains kneeling, head down, blood flowing down his face. The soldiers laugh and move off. Algren kneels by Yoritomo. Yoritomo looks up at him. There are tears in his eyes. EXT.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Katsumoto's house on the outskirts of Tokyo is spacious and harmonious. Utterly Japanese. Samurai guards in full regalia, stand menacingly outside. INT.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Ujio kneels with Yoritomo, dressing the wounds on his head. Graham sits across the room talking quietly to the mammoth Nakao, taking notes in a small notebook. Nakao has been brutally shorn of his top knot as well. His shame is apparent. INT.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Servants he1p dress Katsumoto in his exacting samurai wardrobe as Algren is ushered in.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Captain, I had not thought to see you again.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm leaving tomorrow. But before I go I need to tell you what's going on here.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You mean the Gatling Guns and the howitzers, is that how you sa y it?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: They're about to close a trade agreement that will bring this country more weapons than you can imagine.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes, if the emperor agrees - but Omura knows the Emperor must be convinced there is cause to need those weapons before be will sign.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (realizing) And you are to be the cause...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Elegant, isn't it? Omura passes laws sure to cause a samurai revolt, creating a need for the weapons. The Emperor sees that the weapons are needed so he agrees to the entire treaty, giving your country what it wants and the Omura Zaibatsu what it wants. And my country is sold to yours. As Katsumoto dresses, Algren notes that Katsumoto's body it at battleground of old scars, so like his own.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Today the Council passed two edicts. The first called for the elimination of our traditional topknots.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I know.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The second banned the wearing of sword. Algren stops. He knows what swords mean to the samurai.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (re: his swords) Hand them to me, will you? Algren picks up Katsumoto's two swords. Looks at him deeply.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: If you do this, they will kill you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I am hard to kill.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You don't know what their weapons can do. All your men butchered ... Just for pride.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Not for pride. For the emperor.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: But the emperor is the one signing the agreement.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He has not signed it yet. He holds out Katsumoto's two samurai swords.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Is it worth it? ... just for these,
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I cannot live without my soul ... Can you? They regard each other. EXT.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Algren leaves Katsumoto's gate and sets off on foot. EXT.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: As Algren walks, he becomes aware that he is being followed. Two dark figures lurk some distance behind him. After a few moments, he whips around to face them. They stand for a moment, then melt away into the shadows. INT.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The Council of State meets in an august chamber. Many of the Council members wear Western clothes. Cigarette smoke billows. The young Emperor sits on a dais off to the side, as befits his ceremonial role in the proceedings. Omura is speaking ... be stops ... looking at something ... all the Council members turn ... and gape. Katsumoto strides into the chamber, his swords proudly displayed.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (subtitled) Minister Katsumoto, you honor us.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (subtitled) It is my honor to join again the men who are leading Japan into her glorious future.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (subtitled) You arc perhaps unaware of this Council's edict regarding the wearing of swords?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (subtitled) I read ever y edict with singular attention.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (subtitled) Yet you would bring weapons into this chamber?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (subtitled) This chamber was protected by m y sword for four hundred years--
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (interrupting, subtitled) We need no protection... We are a nation of laws now.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (calm, subtitled) . We are a nation of whores. Selling ourselves to our Western "allies." Katsumoto slowl y looks around at the Members of the Council, but his words are addressed to the Emperor.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (subtitled) Does Japan no longer need its patriots? Omura speaks with quiet conviction and honesty.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (subtitled) Who is the patriot? The man who would keep his country trapped in the past, or the man who would help his people into the future?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (subtitled) A future with no honor,
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (subtitled) Honor means less to me than feeding our children. And teaching them. And giving them modern medicine so they will live.    .
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: And lining your own pockets in the process. They stare at one another with barely concealed hostility.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (subtitled) Minister Katsumoto, it is with great regret that I ask you to remove your sword, as this body has declared in its edict. Katsumoto's hand closes on his sword hilt
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: This sword serves the emperor, and only he can command me to remove it. Katsumoto looks to the Emperor, as murmurs fill the room.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (quickly) Ah, but it is our tradition that the Emperor's voice is too pure and great to be heard in such worldly circumstance as the Council of State. One last time, Katsumoto meets the Emperor's eye.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Then, with great regret, I must refuse to give up my sword. Omura looks to his associates, and a silent decision is made.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Minister Katsumoto, I must invite you to accompany our soldiers to Himeji Castle, where you will be our honored guest. I think you will find the surroundings there quite harmonious. Guards with Mauser rifles move into position around Katsumoto. He turns to the other Council members. Looks at them.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (subtitled) Brothers ... One day you will know what you have done and feel what I never will ... shame. Omura nods to the guards. The guards lead Katsumoto out.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: is loading the last of Algren's luggage on the back of a rickshaw. Algren emerges from the building, sees the same two disreputable MEN who followed him earlier lurking nearby. He resists the temptation to confront them. Instead he climbs into the rickshaw and it starts off. But a moment later, Graham has jogged alongside, huffing and puffing.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What do they want from me?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: To make sure you're on the side of God and Country, or to make sure you get the hell out.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You've been a great help, Graham. I thank you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Look who's getting sentimental now. A look bet ween them, then Algren nods for the bearer to continue. EXT.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Algren stands at the gangplank. Porters wait with his luggage. Algren looks back into the crowd and sees the ronin. They glare back, no longer trying to keep out of sight. A BLAST from the steam whistle. Algren looks from the ship, to the ronin, to the bustling, chaotic city behind them. Finally, he looks out at the harbor and the ocean, beyond which used to lie his home. He turns to the bearer.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (subtitles) Take back to quarters. I walk. And Algren starts back into the city. EXT.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Down a shadowy street, lit only by t orches. Slowl y we realize he is being followed and that he knows it. Up ahead, the street appears to dead-end. The two Ronin step out from the shadows and face him, their hands on their swords. Behind him, Another dangerous looking Ronin joins the one who has been following him. They begin to close in. Algren stands completely still. They grow closer. Algren appears to close his eyes. And the sound of the approaching footsteps fades as We HEAR ONLY the sound of his breathing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . The Ronin draw their swords. Algren gently opens his eyes. Ever ything has SLOWED DOWN: a sign in the breeze, a piece of rubbish on the street, the flame of a nearby torch. A BLUR OF MOTION. Everything happens so fast it is hard to tell just what has taken place. In the strobing shadows, all we really know is that Algren has leapt to the attack. Within seconds, four bodies lie in the street Algren holds bloody sword. His face is cut and a sleeve of his jacket is ripped, but other than that he is unharmed. Ujio has taught him welt As he stands, catching his breath, we HOLD on his face in CLOSE-UP. A sudden flash: We see Algren grab one of the torches and smash it across the ronin's face. It is the attack  replayed in real-time. Rolling to avoid a death-blow, he grabs the fallen man's sword and eviscerates attacker #2. The two remaining Ronin strike. He parries the blow of attacker #3, whirls to slice the legs of attacker #4, whirls again to cut off the hand of attacker #1, who has returned to the attack. Meanwhile, attacker #3 serums and charges -- just lit attacker #4 is trying to stand. Algren steps back as attacker #3 impales attacker #4. Algren steps forward and cuts off the head of attacker #3. Even now, it has happened too fast to be truly appreciated. BACK TO THE STREET We move, closer-still on Algren's face. A sudden flash: And so we watch the attack again. in super-slow motion now, so we can fully appreciate it's terrible beauty. A torch smashes across a face. A sword slices the sleeve of a coat. Sparks fly as two swords meet. 89. A severed hand falls in the dirt. Blood sprays from a decapitated head. A sword is wiped clean. BACK TO THE STREET In real time, Algren kneels to examine one of the dead Ronin. On his arm is tattooed a familiar emblem: The sign of the Omura Zaibatsu EXT.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Omura lives in a huge medieval castle on a promontory directly above Tokyo Ba y. A testament to Japan's martial past. INT.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The bearers lower the rickshaws. Algren and Bagley climb from one. Ambassador Swanbeck climbs from the other. EXT.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Two guards arc: standing at attention in a dank corridor high in one of the towers of the castle. Cell doors line the corridor. Katsumoto's samurai swords lean against the wall next to them. INT.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Katsumoto kneels in a cramped cell. A sound draws his attention. He rises and looks out a barred window. Bel ow he sees two rickshaws moving up the twisting road to the castle. INT.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Algren and Bagley, in formal dress uniforms, sit in one of the rickshaws. Bagley looks him over.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oughtta shave more often, Algren. Becomes you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Thought I would follow the Japanese fashion.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: ...Heard you were leaving, actually?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Why would I do that? Omura wants me to train his personal guard.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Certainly seems obsessed by you. Why do you think that is?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Could it be my nose isn't permanently lodged up his ass? Bagley shakes his bead, turns away. Algren stares up at the looming aide. EXT.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The two rickshaws stop by the heavily-guarded main gates. Guards check the occupants. Motion to other guards atop the gates. The main gates slowl y swing open. EXT.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Omura waits in elegant evening clothes. A woman plays a harp. The interior of Omura's castle is heavy, oppressive. Old Masters paintings dot the walls. Leather-bound boob. Chippendale furniture.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . A samurai concept, don't you think? The two men take each other's measures. Servants appear with trays..
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Servants light their cigars. BAGLEY (re: cigar) A gift from President Grant?
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Gentlemen...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Omura, you have a lovel y home. It must be very old.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Nothing is "old" in Japan, ever ything is "ancient." ... But the views are pleasant. Sit down... They move to chairs by the roaring fireplace as Omura turns to Algren, noticing the cut on his face, but saying nothing.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Do you know your Wagner, Captain? This is the 'Leibestod' from Tristan and Isolde.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm surprised you enjoy it. Literally translated it means `love/death. ' (looks at him)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Champagne? And cigars, of course.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (smiles) Queen Victoria.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Mr. Omura, may I use the necessit y?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Certainly. Omura summons a servant. The servant escorts Algren out.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Now, Mr. Swanbeck, regarding our agreement, I noticed a discrepancy in paragraph seven in reference to the investment protocols for coal. INT.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The servant leads Algren through a corridor, head bowed. Then, stil1 puffing on his cigar, Algren taps the servant on the back, and as the man turns, decks him. The servant falls. Algren flicks hit cigar out onto the sloping roof. We FOLLOW the BURNING EMBER as it rolls off the roof and lands at the feet of TWO CURIOUS GUARDS. EXT.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The guards look up, trying to determine where the cigar butt has come from. But their curiosity lasts only a moment: ARROWS pierce their necks, strangling any sound. We REVERSE to discover that one of the rickshaw-bearers has fired the arrows. As he peels back his hood, we SEE it is Yoritomo. We realize the other bearers are Ujio, Nakao, and Simon Graham. They hurry past the dead guards and up the stairs. INT.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The three samurai and Graham race up the winding parapets. Three GUARDS round a corner. Swords flash as Ujio and Nakao dispatch them without even slowing. They race on, Graham laboring to keep up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . INT.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Algren rounds a corner-- Ujio, Yoritomo, Nakao, and Graham are moving toward him.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: This wa y... Clearly, this has all been Algren's plan. They move up a stairwa y. INT.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: NIGHT The three guards are still standing at attention outside Katsumoto's cell. His swords are next to them. Algren keeps the others out of sight and lowers his head to whisper with Ujio. Ujio nods, then walks into sight and calmly approaches the guards. Still hidden, Algren gestures for the others remain to silent. After a moment, he gestures that they can proceed. Algren and the others round the comer to discover the bloody remains of the three guards - whom Ujio has dispatched in absolute silence. They unlock the cell. INT.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Katsumoto is shocked to see Algren enter. Algren tosses him his swords.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: How's the poem coming?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The ending is proving difficult. INT.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Omura glances up from the documents.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What has become of Captain Algren? INT.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Algren, Katsumoto, and the others race through an upper corridor.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (re:Graham) Who is this?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Name's Simon Graham. Wants to write a book about you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: An honor. I have followed your activities with great interest. I think the European public would be fascinated by a book about your adventures.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Not a book. A play! Suddenly, from below, the raised voices of guards. They hurry a wa y. INT.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Guards carrying pikes race up the stairs-- INT.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Algren and the others are moving swiftl y down a stone corridor. The sound of the approaching guards is growing louder. A silent WILD BUNCH moment of preparation as they stride down the corridor, five abreast. Algren pulls the cavalry saber from his dress uniform. Katsumoto prepares his swords. Nakao stretches his huge arms. Yoritomo and Uji o draw their bows. EXT.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - UPPER COURTYARD                        FOLLOWING Ten guards with rifles patrol the upper battlements. Yoritomo and Uji o crouch and fire. Arrow a fter arrow a fter arrow, as fast as a repeating rifle, the arrows streak through the night. Completely silent. It is a dazzling display. They time shots to sail over walls, shoot through tiny windows, shoot out torches. Multiple arrows. Perfect aim. In a matter of seconds all ten guards are dead. They continue across the courtyard, up some steps -- INT.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They stride through a tight, dark stone corridor. Suddenly, a cadre of Omura guards emerge from the shadows. Without hesitation, they launch into battle. Algren and Katsumoto wield their swords. Yoritomo and Ujio fire arrows. Nakao fights with his hands, dramatic martial arts from the huge man.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . But this corridor is just too tight -- it is a sea of combat.. the guards and our warriors are slammed together --the swords and pikes sending up sparks in the darkness as they strike the stone walls. The right corridor echoes with samurai war cries and clanging swords. Then... More guards appear. These guards have rifles. Rifle blasts thunder --startling strobe-like bursts of light in the darkness -- Algren dives in front of Katsumoto to protect him- Yoritomo is hit- He jerks back -- blood-- Ujio fires arrows at the guards with rifles, hitting two -- but more guards with rifles are appearing, bullets sending showers of debris and ricochets-- Algren sees a stairway leading to a higher 1evel, barks out a command. As Nakao drags Yoritomo toward the stairs-- the others bolt a heavy SIEGE DOOR designed to keep attackers at bay. INT.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Ujio fires arrows through the siege ports -- momentarily delaying the guards as Algren leads them toward a rear stairs. INT.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Algren starts down -- only to discover MORE GUARDS blocking this means of escape. He backs out of the wa y just in time as rifle blasts SPLINTER the wooden stairwe11. Meanwhile, an EXPLOSION from behind them indicates that the guards have blown the siege door. Algren, Graham, and Ujio have no choice but to continue upwards into the castle keep. Nakao helps the wounded Yoritomo as they climb. INT.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: A narrow ladder leads to the final redoubt. They start to climb but Yoritomo leans against the wall. He is gravely wounded.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Come on.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (subtitled) You go, Algren-san. I will stop them.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No--
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: ...Please. Yoritomo's determination is absolute. Finally, Algren nods. Katsumoto moves to Yoritomo, leans in for a few final words, taking his head and pressing his forehead to Yoritomo's. Bullets begin ricocheting around them -- Yoritomo looks to Algren:
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (subtitled) Tell my family. Algren bows his bead in respect. Then Algren leads them up the stairs. Ujio fires a final volley, nods with respect to Yoritomo, then follows the others. Yoritomo pulls himself erect. Draws his two samurai swords. A beat. He closes his eyes. Smiles. Then he opens his eyes and hurls himself down the stairs-- The guards fire hitting Yoritomo - but still he comes -- wading into them swords flashing -- he is hit again and again -- but still he comes. It is a glorious death. EXT.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Algren leads them into the highest room of the castle, the siege room. The echoes Yoritomo's death rings in their ears.                                   . Katsumoto glances at Ujio and Nakao. Without a word, they kneel on the floor, open their kimonos and unsheathe their short-swords, preparing to commit seppuku.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No. Wait...! Katsumoto glares at him harshly, furious to have his concentration disturbed at such a moment.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: There's a wa y out. Look--! Reluctantly, Katsumoto joins him at the window.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: This place is designed to keep people from getting in, not from getting out. We can make it
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: This was your plan?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Do you have a better one? Nakao and Ujio look at Katsumoto, awaiting his response. He turns to Algren.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I may die. But I'll die trying. And without another word he LAUNCHES himself out the window, onto the sloping roof. EXT.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Like his cigar butt earlier in the sequence, he rolls, then falls, hits another roof, rolls, slides, falls, hits again. INT.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Katsumoto and the others share a look. Has he survived? GUNFIRE begins to pepper the floorboards, bullets whistling past them. EXT.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Algren slides, bumps, rolls, falls, hits, then slides again. Until he finally plummets into the moat. As his head rises above water, he lets out a scream of absolute joy. INT.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Katsumoto hears the scream. A look of disbelief spreads over his face. Then the beginnings of a smile. Without a second look, be leaps out the window. Ujio follows. Graham shrinks away in fear. Nakao lifts him bodily, throws him out, and then follows. INT.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Omura stands, very calm, smoking a cigarette, listening to the report of his guards. Colonel Bagley tries to apologize.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: ... 1 don't know what to say, sir. I never would have thought him capable of treason.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I would say Captain Algren's acts tonight have assured our success.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What do you mean?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Katsumoto will rejoin his kinsmen. They will fight. We will destroy them with your new weapons.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What if he just goes off to the mountains and becomes a damn sheep-herder or some such?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You still do not understand us ... Katsumoto can do nothing but fight. It is his role in the drama. He must act out his destiny. He knows it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You trust a lot in destiny.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: This story was written years ago. From the first sight of your warships in our harbor... (stares out the window) It is a1l inevitable. EXT.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Algren, Katsumoto, and the others ride over rocky ground.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) June 1, 1877. Yesterday, I passed the field where Zebulon Gant was killed by the man with whom I now ride. In the distance a steam train chugs along. Inevitable. Progress. EXT.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: They climb a steep trail. Beyond, the glaciers glow pink.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . The leader leaps from his horse and bows, touching his head to the dirt. All the other samurai follow suit. EXT.    CHERRY TREE FOREST--NEAR THE VILLAGE                       EVENING Katsumoto rides at the head of his samurai as they pass through the cherry orchard. Then he reins his horse and falls in beside Algren.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) I am beset by ironies -- trained to fight rebels now I am one. And yet 1 ask mysel f... can a man be reborn?: Algren, Katsumoto, and the others ride through a dense forest Katsumoto reins his horse. The others follow suit. They wait
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) And if so, what would he make of it? Mounted samurai emerge from the thick forest As it they were invisible.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (his voice troubled) I was prepared to die in Omura's castle. And yet here I am. I cannot help but ask why were you sent into my life. What is the lesson you were meant to give me?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Maybe that neither of us is as smart as we thought... Katsumoto laugh. And then in a surprisingly deft imitation of Algren
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You...ain't whistlin' Dixie... He spurs his horse and heads off. Algren shakes his head and follows. EXT.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The returning warriors are warmly welcomed by the villagers. Algren rides directly to Yoritomo's house, dismounts. Taka and Toshiie are waiting. He goes to them. His expression tells them all they need to know. INT.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Algren sits with the family. The boys sit next to their mother.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (subtitles) ... he gave his life to save us. He died bravel y.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (subtitles) Thank you, Algren-San.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (subtitles) Will you fight the white men?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (subtitles) If they come here, yes.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (subtitles) Why?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (subtitles) Because they come to destroy what I have come to love. Taka looks at him, moved and surprised. Suddenly, Higen jumps up and bolts... out of the room. Algren looks to Taka.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (subtitles) The wa y of Samurai is difficult for children. He misses his father.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: And he is angry because I am the cause of that. She smiles ever so slightly at his obliviousness.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No. He it angry because he fears you will die as well. EXT.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Higen stands, looking up at the stars.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: MOUNTAINS          DAY Algren and Katsumoto perch on a precipice, looking down into a valley. It is a beautiful setting. Towering peaks and peaceful valleys. It is here that the final act of the inevitable drama will play out. Bel ow they see the Imperial Army, thousands strong, marching across the valley toward them. Terrifying martial columns in strict formation.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Higen.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (subtitles) My father taught me it is glorious to die in battle.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (subtitles) That is what he believed.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (subtitles) I would be afraid to die in battle.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (subtitles) So would I.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (subtitles) But you have been in many battles.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (subtitles) And I was always afraid. Higen looks at him, tears welling in his eyes.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (subtitles) I don't want you to go. Algren has no answer. He can only gather the boy up in his arms and hold him. EXT VILLAGE DAY Nakao is standing proudly, his massive arms folded across his chest. We pull back: Graham is bunched behind his photographic equipment. A flash of phosphorous and the moment is immortalized. Meanwhile, Algren is working with Higen on the house. Katsumoto silently watches Algren working with the boy.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Algren-san. Algren turns.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: They are corning. EXT
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I call it five thousand troops. They'll come in waves of about a thousand, a few minutes between each wave. Katsumoto listens carefully to Algren's expertise.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: German formations have the infantry staggered with on1y light flanking. They'll come straight on with rifles and fixed bayonets. Mausers are only accurate to about 150 yards. They'll look to overthrow us. Katsumoto takes this in. EXT.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Colonel Bagley, Omura, several German advisors and Japanese officers ride at the head of the Imperial Army.                                         . Bagley sees something, raises a hand. The troops halt. Algren and Katsumoto ride up to them. Stop.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Colonel.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Captain... (to Katsumoto)... Sir, the Imperial Army of Japan demands your surrender. If you and your fellows lay down your arms you will not be harmed.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That is not possible. As Omura knows. Omura meets Katsumoto's look, nods. Bagley turns to Algren.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Captain Algren, we will show no quarter. You ride against us and you are the same as they are.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I take that as a compliment, Colonel. (a deadly calm) I'll look for you on the field. Algren and Katsumoto wheel their horses and go. EXT.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Algren and Katsumoto ride.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Katsumoto considers this. Algren looks up into the mountains.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . On the stage, Katsumoto spots Algren in the audience, points to him and encourages him to join him. Algren resists. Toshiie prods him. Algren surrenders and joins Katsumoto on the stage. The villagers are delighted. Katsumoto embroils Algren in the performance. Algren does his best, laughing at Katsumoto's antics. It is the freest and happiest we have ever seen Algren. Time SLOWS as we Savor his simple enjoyment Toshiie is highly amused. Taka has a deeper response, she is moved as she watches Algren give himself over to the part. EXT.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: They have the howitzers.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: How many?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: About a dozen.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: A man could get lost up there ... Build an army. Hold out a very long time.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Algren-san...Have you seen what happens to the villages that stand In the way of the railroad? Algren nods. He remembers.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That is what will happen to my village if we do not stand and fight. (looks at him) No. We serve the Emperor here.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: By dying?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Perhaps.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: At least make it battle, not a suicide.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: And what would that accomplish? Algren lifts his head, enjoying the feeling of the sun and wind on his face.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It might give you one more day ... One more fine day like this. Katsumoto stares at him for a long moment, then smiles and spurs his horse. Algren follows. They ride together, side by aide, the wind billowing their cloaks -- We enjoy the ride as they do, the trees strobing by, the sun slanting through the leaves. EXT.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It is the eve of battle. And the samurai rejoice. Katsumoto is on stage at the center of the village square, enthusiastically performing a Noh drama. Algren sits with Toshiie and Taka in the audience, enjoying Katsumoto's theatrics. Other samurai can be seen around the village, eating, singing, and playing instruments. Tonight is for celebrating life. Elsewhere, a flash as Graham takes a photograph of some children.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: A somber mood has descended. Algren sits and writes in his journal.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Algren leaves Graham and accompanies Taka toward the house. They pass Higen and Toshiie, who sit with other children at the feet of the massive Nakao, listening to a quiet story he tells, INT.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) July 14, 1877. For so long now, I have managed to convince myself that there was nothing worth believing in. A samurai plays a melancholy bamboo flute. The gentle sound floats through the village...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) Certainly nothing worth dying for. We see samurai preparing for the final battle. Some check their armor... Others meditate...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) Now I am not so sure. Some make up their faces so they will look handsome when they greet death. Some methodically polish their swords. Some sit with their families.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) And so, for the first time in my life, I am truly afraid. Not of dying. But of losing something worth living for. Ujio is performing a graceful, ritualistic sword-dance to the song of the flute. Algren Joins Graham to watch him.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What is it:? .
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The kenbu,.. his dance of death. Taka comes to them.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (subtitles) Algren-san, will you come with me?
dialogue.name: dialogue
